Superior to or notable above all others; outstanding.     突出的高于所有其他的或比所有人都显著的；杰出的 The firm recognized Tom's outstanding work by giving him an extra bonus.     公司发给汤姆一笔额外奖金以表彰他工作出色.

column2: v. 超过&跑过 vt. 胜过&超过
column3: Demand is outstripping current production.     现在需求逐渐超过了生产能力. We soon outstripped the slower runners.     我们很快就超过那些跑得慢的人.
On no account should we cut down the outturn.     我们绝不可以把产量降低。 No doubt you've received the outturn samples of the inferior quality goods.     你们一定收到了质量低劣产品的到货抽样。

column2: a. 向外的&表面的&外服的 ad. 向外&在外&表面
column3: The two things are the same in outward form but different in essence.     那两样东西在外表上相同&但在本质上不同。 He was to all outward appearances dead.     他显然已经死了.
The door opened outwards.     这门是朝外开的。 Does the window open inwards or outwards?     这窗户是朝里开的还是朝外开的?

column2: v. 比...为重&比...重要&比...有价值
column3: The advantages far outweigh the disadvantages in this case.     这件事上&利远大于弊。 This outweighs all other considerations.     这一点是首要考虑的。

column2: n. 椭圆形 a. 卵形的&椭圆形的
column3: The playing field is a large oval.     球场很大&呈椭圆形。 The mirror is oval.     镜子是椭圆的。

column2: n. 热烈欢迎&大喝采&大受欢迎
column3: The singer got a ten-minute standing ovation.     观众起立向那位歌手鼓掌达十分钟. After a while Lenin came out on the stage. The ovation was unlike anything I have ever seen. Lenin let it continue for a few minutes& standing absolutely still& then with a single motion of his arms across his body stopped the uproar instantaneously and you could have heard a pin drop.     不久列宁在台上出现了&那种热烈的欢呼是我从未见过的。列宁先静静地站了几分钟&让欢呼声继续着&然后用手在胸前横挥一下&喝彩声马上终止&于是连一根针落地的声音你都可以听得到。
It is like an oven in here; please open the window.     这里热得象火炉&请把窗户打开。 The bread is baking in the oven.     烤箱里正在烤面包。

column2: a. 结束的 ad. 结束 prep. 在...的上方 v. 越过
column3: The meeting is over.     会议结束了。 You'd better think it over carefully.     你最好仔细考虑一下。

column2: a. 全部的&全体的&一切在内的 ad. 总的来说&全部地
column3: There's been an overall improvement recently.     近来各方面都有所改进。 The overall measurement of this room is 80 square meters.     这个屋子的面积是80平方米。

column2: a. 阴天的&阴暗的&愁闷的
column3: It's a bit overcast; it might rain.     天有点阴&可能下雨。 There is a gloomy& overcast expression on his face.     他愁眉苦脸。

column2: v. 讨价过高&装药过多&过度充电 n. 超载&装药过多&过度充电
column3: We were overcharged for the eggs.     我们的鸡蛋买贵了. That grocer never overcharges.     那杂货商从不多要价.
I took off my overcoat since it was warm.     天气很暖和&我就把大衣脱了。 She didn't put on an overcoat though it was very cold outside.     外头虽冷&她却没披件外套。

column2: a. 充满了的&占据了的 v. 战胜&克服
column3: Can you overcome your shortcomings?     你可以克服你的缺点吗？ We need a spirit of enterprise if we are to overcome our difficulties.     如果我们要克服困难&我们就要有进取精神。

column2: v. 做得过分&过度&夸张
column3: He's been overdoing things recently.     近来他做事过分努力. You must stop overdoing it you'll make yourself ill.     不要过劳了--你要生病的.

He has a huge overdraft to pay off.     他有一大笔透支要偿还. The bank manager said that& in order to bring me down to earth and control my spending& I would have no overdraft facility and my cheque card would be withdrawn.     银行经理说&为了使我从幻想中清醒过来并控制我的开支&将不给我有透支的便利&并还将收回我的支票卡。

column2: v. 拉过度&夸大&夸张 v. 透支
column3: Overdraw a bow.     把弓拉得过紧

column2: a. 过期的&未兑的&迟到的
column3: Please let us have your check for the$60 now past overdue.     迟付的60美元&请速予寄下为荷。 Legislative reform is long overdue.     立法方面的改革早该进行。

column2: v. 评价过高&出价过高 n. 估计过高&评价过高&出价过高
column3: I overestimated his abilities he's finding the job very difficult.     我过高估计了他的能力--现在他觉得工作非常困难. I overestimated the amount of milk we'd need for the weekend.     我过高估计了我们周末的用奶量.

column2: v. 使...承担过多的义务
column3: Any users of credit may overextend themselves.     每个贷款使用者都有可能作出不自量力的事。

column2: n. 溢值&超值&泛滥 v. 泛滥&溢出&充溢 [计算机] 溢出
column3: Overflow patients lay on the floors and in the corridors.     容纳不下的病人躺在地上和走廊里。 The crowd overflowed the auditorium.     人群挤得礼堂无法容纳。

column2: v. 分解检查&翻修&精细检查； 超车、赶上  n. 分解检查&精细检查
column3: The engine is due for an overhaul.     那台发动机该大修了. The fast cruiser soon overhauled the old cargo boat.     快速巡逻艇迅即赶上那艘旧货船.

column2: n. 经常开支&普通用费 a. 在头上的&高架的 ad. 在头顶上&在空中&在高处 [计算机] 总开销
column3: Their office is in central Beijing& so their overhead is very high.     他们的办事处设在北京市中心&所以他们的日常开支很大。 Seagulls were circling overhead.     海鸥在头顶山盘旋。
I overheard some cruel remarks about him.     我无意中听到了一些议论他的粗鲁的话。 I overheard them saying they were unhappy.     我偶然听到他们说&他们很不快乐。
Fill your radiator with water& or your engine will overheat.     给你的散热器充水&否则引擎会过热。

It's a problem of such perplexity that it was impossible to solve.     那是个复杂得无法解决的问题。 She looked at us in perplexity.     她茫然地看着我们。

He persecuted me with various delicate questions.     他用种种微妙的问题把我难倒了。 They came to America after being persecuted for their religious beliefs.     他们是在他们因宗教信仰而受到迫害之后来到美洲的。

The Jews suffered terrible persecution under Hitler's rule.     犹太人在希特勒的统治下受到残酷的迫害。 A psychotic disorder characterized by delusions of persecution or grandeur& often strenuously defended with apparent logic and reason.     妄想狂&偏执狂一种通常用表面的逻辑和道理来设想的具烦扰或夸大妄想特征的精神错乱症

A few persevering climbers finally reached the top.     少数几个攀登者坚忍不拔&终於登上了顶峰。 Refusing to give up or let go; persevering obstinately.     坚持不懈的&执意的拒绝放弃或听任的；顽固坚持的

column2: v. 小孩般说话&说半截话&闲聊 n. 半截话&无聊话

column2: v. 祈祷&祈求&请求&恳求
column3: They went to the mosque to pray.     他们去清真寺做祷告。 They prayed that their enemies might be defeated.     他们祈求上苍让敌人失败。

column2: n. 祈祷&祷告&祷文 v. 祷告&祷文
column3: Her prayer answered and her son came home safely.     她的祈祷应验了&儿子平安地回到了家。 The congregation in the church knelt in prayer.     教堂的会众跪下来祈祷。
The priest preached a sermon on the need of charity.     牧师在布道会上宣讲慈爱的必要。 Those people go around preaching revolution.     那些人到处宣扬革命。

column2: n. 传道者&讲道者&牧师
column3: Do you believe in what the preacher said?     你相信这个传道者的话吗？ Preacher say& do as I say& not as I do.     说教者言：照我所说的去做&但不要做我所做的。

column2: a. 说教的 n. 说教
column3: I am weary of his preaching.     我听腻了他的说教。 Those people go around preaching revolution.     那些人到处宣扬革命。
He launched into his statement without any preamble.     他开门见山地发表言论. He spoke without preamble.     他没有开场白地讲起来。

column2: v. 预先安排&预先协定&预定

column3: She makes a rather precarious living as a novelist.     作为小说家&她过着不太稳定的生活. He was unable to get down from his precarious position on the rocks.     他无法从岩石危险的位置上下来。
He balanced precariously on the narrow window-ledge.     他在狭窄的窗台上很难保持平衡.
I took the precaution of locking everything in the safe.     我把一切东西都锁在保险箱里以防万一。 You should take an umbrella just as a precaution.     你该带把伞&有备无患。

column2: a. 预先警戒的&预防的&留心的
v. 在...之前&优于&较...优先
column3: He came in& preceded by his wife.     他和他的妻子一前一后地走了进来。 He preceded his speech with a few words of welcome the special guests.     他在演讲之前先说了几句对特邀来宾表示欢迎的话。
The needs of the community must take precedence over (ie must be met before) individual requirements.     公众的利益高於个人的利益. The longest-serving officer always takes precedence.     任职时间最长的官员事事优先.

column2: a. 在前的&在先的 n. 先例&前例
column3: This intervention in another nation's affairs has set a precedent which we hope other countries will not follow.     对别国事物的这种干涉开了一个先例&我们希望其他国家不要模仿。 This decision creates a dangerous precedent.     这个决定开创了一个危险的先例。

This intervention in another nation's affairs has set a precedent which we hope other countries will not follow.     对别国事物的这种干涉开了一个先例&我们希望其他国家不要模仿。 Institutions of government are established by law or precedent.     行政制度是依据法律兴惯例制定的。

This point has been dealt with in the preceding paragraph.     这一点在前面一段里已经交代过了. An introductory performance& event& or action preceding a more important one; a preliminary or preface.     序幕先于较重要部分的介绍性表演&事件或行动；开端或序
Example is better than precept.     st. 以身作则胜于口头教诲. Just follow these few basic precepts and you won't go far wrong in life.     只要按这几条格言行事&你一生就不会出大错。

column2: n. 选区&管理区&管辖区域
column3: Don't leave the school precincts during school hours.     在上课期间内不要离开学校。 No parking within the hospital precincts.     医院范围内禁止停放车辆.

column2: n. 过于讲究&矫揉造作

column3: My time is precious; I can only give you a few minutes.     我的时间很宝贵&我只能见你几分钟。 That old book is my most precious possession.     那本旧书是我最珍贵的财产。
A flat facet cut across the top of a precious stone.     切平面在一颗宝石的顶部切出的平面 The dealer was slavering over some precious stones.     那商人对一些宝石垂涎欲滴.
In 1939 everyone felt Europe was on the edge of the precipice.     在1939年&当时人人都感到欧洲处于极度危险的境地。 Do not seat your love upon a precipice because it is high.     不要因为峭壁是高的&便让你的爱情坐在峭壁上。

column2: n. 沉淀物 v. 使...陷入&促成&使...沉淀
column3: Fears about the solvency of the banks precipitated the great economic crash.     对银行偿付能力出现恐慌更加速了经济的崩溃。 They acted with precipitate haste.     他们鲁莽仓促地采取了行动。

column2: n. 坠落&沉淀&凝结;冰雹
column3: There will be precipitation on northern hills tonight.     今夜北部山区有降雪。 The treatment of metal or the separation of metal from ores and ore concentrates by liquid processes& such as leaching& extraction& and precipitation.     水冶金术通过液体过程&象过滤&提炼&沉淀等方法处理金属&从矿石中或矿石浓缩物中分离出金属

column2: a. 险峻的(突然的&急躁的)
column3: We have a precipitous climb to the peak.     我们向着陡峭山顶攀登。 A precipitous path led down the mountainside.     沿着山腰下来有一条陡峭的山路。
At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step& the bus started.     恰恰就在我登上公共汽车踏板的时候&车子开动了。 The state or quality of being precise; exactness.     精确精确的状态或性质；准确性
That answers precisely to our need.     那恰好符合我们的需要。 My own view precisely.     我正是这样看的。

column2: a. 精确的 n. 精确&精密度
column3: The diagram had been copied with great precision.     该图表的复印件很精确。 Your report lacks precision.     你的报告不够准确。
That will preclude him from escaping.     那将阻止他逃走&那将使他无法逃走。 My present finances preclude the possibility of buying a car.     按我目前的财务状况我是不可能买车的。
His son is a precocious child who could play the piano at the age of three.     他的儿子是一个三岁就能弹奏钢琴的早慧儿童。 That child is far too precocious.     孩子过于老成。

column2: a. (思想、观点等)事先形成的
column3: Tourists forget their preconceived ideas as soon as they visit our country.     游客访问了我国之後立刻消除了他们的先入之见. The act or state of holding unreasonable preconceived judgments or convictions.     偏见提前持有非理智判断或信念的行为或状态

column2: n. 预想(先入之见&偏见)
column3: Common preconceptions about life in this district are increasingly being challenged.     原先普遍存在著对那一地区生活的成见越来越站不住脚了.

column2: v. 事先具备条件&事先训练 n. 先决条件
n. 先驱者&前导&先进者
column3: The precursor of the modern car was a horseless carriage with a petrol engine.     现代汽车的前身是不用马拉的&装有汽油发动机的车子。 British poet considered a precursor of romanticism. His best-known work& The Task(1785)& praises rural life and leisure.     科伯&威廉1731－1800英国诗人&被认为是浪漫主义的先锋。他的最杰出的作品任务赞美了农村生活和休闲

Young birds are very vulnerable to predators.     幼小的鸟易受食肉动物伤害. Cats are warm and affectionate creatures to us& but viewed through the eyes of birds and mice they are vicious predators.     对我们来说&猫是热情又充满深情的动物&但是在鸟儿和老鼠看来&猫是恶毒的食肉动物。

column2: a. 掠夺的&进行掠夺的&捕食生物的
column3: A predatory operation mounted against a competitor& especially an attempt to lure away the personnel or membership of a competing organization.     掠夺对竞争对手采取的掠夺式的行动&尤指目的在于吸引走竞争组织的人员或成员 A person of a rapacious& predatory& or profiteering nature.     贪婪的人具有贪婪、凶残或逐利性格的人
Our new doctor is much younger than his predecessor.     我们新来的医生比他的前任年轻许多。 He undid most of the good work of his predecessor.     他把前任的大部分业绩毁掉了。
Believing in or based on the doctrine of predestination.     信仰宿命论的&依据宿命论的相信宿命论教义的或以宿命论教义为基础的
It seemed that his failure was predestined.     他的失败似乎是命中注定的. She was obviously predestined to succeed.     她显然注定了能成功.
Your refusal puts me in an awkward predicament.     你的拒绝让我感到十分为难。 A loan of money would help me out of my predicament.     只需一笔贷款就能帮我摆脱困境。

column2: n. 述语 a. 述语的 v. 断定为&意味
column3: In general& a grammatical clause contain a subject and a predicate.     一般说来&一个合乎文法的子句包含有主词与述语。 A word or words used after a verb to complete a predicate construction; for example& the phrase to eat ice cream in We like to eat ice cream.     补语跟在一个动词后的一个或几个单词共同组成的谓语结构；例如&在我们喜欢吃冰淇淋一句中的短语吃冰淇淋
The economists predicted an increase in the rate of inflation.     经济学家预言通货膨胀率将会增长。 The fortune-teller predicted that I would marry a doctor.     算命先生预言我会同一位医生结婚。
I knew you'd say that you're so predictable!     我早就知道你会这样说--果不其然!
Predictably& he left his umbrella in the train.     如所预料&他把雨伞遗留在火车上。 I asked the boss for a rise and his reply was predictably short and sweet!     我要求老板增加我的工资&他的回答如预料的一样简单明了！
Do you take seriously his prediction of a government defeat?     他预计政府要受挫折&你认为这话靠得住吗？ We all believed in her prediction.     我们都相信她的预言。
A strong predilection for anything French.     法国狂偏爱一切法国事物的强烈偏见

column2: n. 易患病的体质    倾向;素质

column2: a. 优越的&卓越的&有力的

column2: v. 掌握&控制&成为主流

column2: a. 优秀的&超群的&卓越的

I say this jump is preemptive.     我说这样跳是先发制人的。

column2: v. 整理羽毛&(人)打扮修饰

Cold food would be preferable in this heat.     在这样的热天吃冷食更好。 He finds country life preferable to that of living in the city.     他感到在乡村生活比在城市更好。
She wanteda cake& preferably one with chocolate icing.     她想吃蛋糕& 最好是有巧克力糖衣的. They want to buy a new house& near the sea preferably.     他们要购买一所新房子& 最好在海边.
In considering people for jobs& we give preference to those with some experience.     对于求职者&我们优先考虑有一定经验的人。 We've granted that country special trade preferences.     我们给了那个国家特殊的贸易优惠。

column2: a. 先取的&优先的&选择的

In politics Britain has preferred evolution to revolution.     在政治上&英国喜欢渐进而不喜欢革命。 She had had many proposals (of marriage) but preferred to remain single.     许多人向她求过婚& 但她愿过独身生活.

You are advised not to smoke during pregnancy.     怀孕期间你最好不要吸烟。 This is her first pregnancy.     这是她第一次怀孕。

column2: a. 怀孕的 vt. 怀孕

She regarded her critics as ignorant and prejudiced.     她认为那些批评她的人既无知又存有偏见。 Since I am his mother& my opinion of him is naturally a prejudiced one.     因为我是他的母亲&对他的看法自然是带有偏向的。

column2: a. 存有偏见的&偏心的&有害的

column2: a. 无文字记录的&文字以前的

column2: a. 早熟的&过早的&不按时的 n. 早产儿&早发

column2: ad. 过早地& 早熟地

column3: A premeditated crime.     有预谋的犯罪 The crime was premeditated.     犯罪是预谋好的。

column2: n. 总理&首相 a. 第一的&首位的&最初的

column2: v. 初次公演&初演主角
column3: We went to the premiere of their new presentation.     我们去观看了他们的新剧目的首场演出。 A galaxy of film stars attended the premiere.     一群影星参加了首次公演。

column2: n. 前提 v. 提论&预述
column3: Keep off the premises.     请勿入内。 British justice works on the premise that an accused person is innocent until he's proved guilty.     英国司法运作的前提是被告在被证明有罪之前是清白的。

column2: n. 前提 v. 立前提
column3: Alcohol may not be consumed on the premises.     （指公债和股票）超过正常或市面的价值；溢价。 Keep off the premises.     请勿入内。

column2: n. 额外费用&奖金&保险费
column3: The annual premium on my policy is 3000 yuan.     我的保险单每年的保险费是三千元。 The examiners put a premium on rational argument.     评委们对以理服人的论据给以高度评价。
The day before her accident& she had a premonition of danger.     在发生事故的前一天&她有一种会发生危险的预感。
Prenatal medical care.     出生前的医学护理

column2: 结婚前的& 婚礼前的
n. 先取&先入成见&偏见
column3: She found his preoccupation with money irritating.     她发觉他心里只有钱& 感到很生气. His main preoccupation at that time was getting enough to eat.     他那时盘算的是如何填饱肚子.

column2: a. 心事重重的&出神的
column3: Deep in thought and heedless of present circumstances or activities; preoccupied.     心不在焉的&茫然的陷入沉思且未注意到周围的情况或活动的；出神的 Health worries preoccupied him for the whole holiday.     整个假期里他一直为健康状况而担忧.
She seemed preoccupied all the time I was talking to her.     我跟她讲话时她始终显得心事重重. He answered me in a rather preoccupied manner.     他心不在焉地回答我.
Prep a surface for painting.     准备一个平面来作画 Four years of prep school should polish those children.     四年的预科学习应该让这些孩子变得温文尔雅
Preparations for the Queen's visit are almost complete.     女王访问的筹备工作已基本就绪。 He didn't do any preparation for this exam& so he failed.     他考试前没做任何准备&所以不及格。

column2: a. 预备的&准备的&初步的
column3: They finished the preparatory training.     他们完成了预备训练。 What are your preparatory measures?     你的初步措施是什么？
He is preparing his speech for the meeting tomorrow.     他正准备明天集会的演说。 Early experiments with military rockets prepared the ground for space travel.     早年对军用火箭进行的实验为发展航天技术奠定了基础。

column2: a. 有准备的(特别处理过的) v. 准备

The telegram was sent reply prepaid.     电报已发出并已预付复电费用。 I use a prepaid envelope.     我用了一个邮资已付的信封。

column2: a. 以重胜的&优势的&压倒性的
column3: Melancholy is the preponderant mood of the poem.     忧郁的感情是该诗的基调.

column2: v. 以重量胜过&占优势&胜过
column3: Christians preponderate in the population of that part of the country.     基督教徒在该国那一地区的人口中居多.
Preposition is abbreviated as "prep" in this dictionary.     介词在词典中略作 “prep”。

column2: a. 讨人欢喜的&有魅力的&给人好感的
column3: Clean clothes and good manners are prepossessing.     清洁的衣服和良好的举止能给人以好感。 Perhaps the least prepossessing quality of Fox was that he cares too much about the ephemeral in politics: and Ford displays excessive zeal& to my mind& in teasing out these cares to the last twist and turn.     也许福克斯最不逗人喜欢的一点就是他把短促的政治生命看得过于重了。而在我看来&福特在诱使福克斯说出他的这些关心时显得过分热情&手法千奇百怪&使尽了手段。
They are asking a preposterous price for the work.     他们为该作品漫天要价。 The result is preposterous.     结果很可笑。

column2: n. 出版前的非正式样本 v. 预先印好

column3: A sense of humour is prerequisite to understanding her work.     要理解她的作品就必须具有幽默感。 Good muscles are one of the prerequisites of physical fitness.     肌肉发达是身体健康的一个必备条件.

column2: a. (有)特权的 n. 特权

He had a resurrection of hope.     他的希望复苏了。 His resurrection frightened us.     他的复活吓坏了我们。

column2: n. 零售 v. 零售&转述

The retailer has to absorb the cost of wastage.     零售商须承受耗损的费用. The retailer accepted the shipment on consignment.     零售商接受了运来的寄售物品
I will retain my right.     我将保留我的权力。 He retained the best lawyer in the state to defend his case.     他为他的案子聘了该州最好的律师。

An attendant; a retainer.     随从&侍从；家臣 Her new impression of him is strengthened by the evidence of an old Darcy family retainer who has nothing but good to say of Darcy.     她对于他的这种新印象&由于达西家一个老家仆的证明而又得到加深&这老家仆对达西赞不绝口。

column2: v.&n. 夺回&取回&再取&重摄&补拍

column3: If we impose import duties& other countries may retaliate against us.     我们若徵收进口税& 别的国家就可能报复我们. He slapped his sister& who retaliated by kicking him.     他打了妹妹一巴掌& 他妹妹回敬他一脚.

A feud between two families or clans that arises out of a slaying and is perpetuated by retaliatory acts of revenge; a blood feud.     族间血仇&血系间的复仇由杀戳引起的并通过以牙还牙的报复行为而持续不断的两个家族或宗族之间的世仇；血仇 The raid was purely retaliatory.     这次袭击完全是报复性的。

column2: n. 阻止&迟延 v. 妨碍&迟延&迟缓
column3: Lack of sun retards plant growth.     光照不足则植物生长缓慢. Cold weather retards the growth of the crops.     寒冷的天气妨碍了庄稼生长。

column2: n. 智力迟钝&精神发育迟缓
column3: A person of profound mental retardation having a mental age below three years and generally being unable to learn connected speech or guard against common dangers. The term belongs to a classification system no longer in use and is now considered offensive.     低智商者指智力水平在三岁小孩以下&听不懂连贯话语&也不会提防普通危险的智力有严重障碍的人。这个词现在已不用来区别人的类型&现在被认为有对人不友好的意思 A person of mild mental retardation having a mental age of from7 to12 years and generally having communication and social skills enabling some degree of academic or vocational education. The term belongs to a classification system no longer in use and is now considered offensive.     痴愚者一个人智能迟缓发展&仅具有7岁到12岁的智能&一般在一定程度的学术或职业教育后能够进行交流和掌握社会技术。这个词是一个集合概念&现在不再使用&并被视为带有侮辱意味

column3: She is a retinue of doctor.     她是医生的助手。 The Queen was flanked by a retinue of bodyguards and policemen.     女王左右有保镖和警察护卫着。

column2: n. 退休&退职 v. 退休
column3: Our armies have retired to regroup for a fresh attack.     我们的部队已经退下来重新整编&以便发动新的进攻。 The boxer retired from the contest with eye injuries.     该拳击手因眼部受伤而退出比赛。

column2: a. 隐退的&退休的&退役的
column3: The retired film star sequestered herself from the world.     这位退休的影星过着隐居的生活。 I put him down as a retired naval officer.     我看他是个退役的海军军官.
There have been several retirements in my office lately.     最近我那办公室里有几个人退休了。 The manager urged older staff to take up early retirement.     经理敦促年纪较大的职员提前退休。

column2: a. 隐居的&不喜社交的
column3: Joanna had a gentle retiring disposition.     乔安娜性格温柔而腼腆。 Retiring early from his job freed him to join several local clubs.     他早早退休& 摆脱了工作的羁绊而加入了当地的几个俱乐部.

column2: n. 反驳&顶嘴&蒸馏器 v. 反驳&回嘴&反击
column3: He retorted that it was my fault as much as his.     他反驳说我的错误并不比他的小。 He retorted& "it's entirely your fault."     他反驳说：“这完全是你的错误。”
Retouch is made to the goods the cases of which get wet by the tidal water.     被潮水浸湿的箱子中的货物正在进行整修。
He often retraces the happy time during his young age.     他经常回忆起年轻时代的幸福时光。 The police retraced the movements of the murder victim.     警方追溯了被谋杀者当时的动作。

column2: vt. 缩进(拉回&退回&取消) n. 收缩核

Inflation has forced us to retrench.     因通货膨胀我们不得不紧缩开支.

The revelation of his scandalous past led to his resignation.     他那不光彩历史的揭露导致了他的辞职。 Have you read the ex-minister's amazing revelations in the newspaper?     你看了前任部长在报上揭露的那些惊人的事实没有？

The government's revenue is made up chiefly of the money we pay in taxes.     政府的收入主要来源是靠我们所交的税。 The Inland Revenue have sent me a tax bill for more than a hundred pounds& but they can't get blood out of a stone because I just haven't got the money.     国内税务署寄给我一张100多英镑的税单&不过他们不可能从石头里榨出油来&因为我并没有那么多钱。
The roar of the train reverberated in the tunnel.     火车的轰隆声在隧道里回荡. The room reverberated with the noise of the shot.     房间里回响著枪声.

These students have reverence for their teacher.     这些学生很尊敬他们的老师。 Feeling reverence& dread& or awe.     敬畏的感到尊敬&害怕或崇拜的

He is indulging in reveries about the future.     他正沉浸于对未来的幻想之中。 She fell into a reverie about her childhood.     她沉浸在对童年往事的遐想中。
A sharp reversal of direction& as of a ball carrier in football.     急转向相反方向急转&如橄榄球比赛中的持球球员的反切动作 A reversal& as in policy; an about-face.     向后转转向反面&如在政策上；大转变

The fields have reverted to moorland.     那片田地又变成了荒地。 After her divorce she reverted to her maiden name.     她离婚后又重新使用娘家的姓。

column2: n. 评论者(书评作者&报刊评论员)

Their much reviled system in fact works far better than many highly praised ones elsewhere.     他们那套遭到许多非难的设备操纵起来实际上要比别的地方许多备受赞扬的设备好得多。

column2: n. 校订&修正&再校稿 v. 校订&修正&校正

column2: n. 校订&修正&修订本 n. 复习&重温
column3: Our budget needs drastic revision.     我们的预算需作重大修改。 The catalogue is under revision.     目录正在修订之中。

column3: I think we have to revitalize our society.     我觉得我们的社会需要新生。

column2: n. 复兴&复活&恢复精神
column3: Our economy is undergoing a revival.     我们的经济正处于复苏阶段。 The patient had a speedy revival after her operation.     那个女病人在手术后迅速康复。

column2: vt. 撤回(回想) n. 取消(回想)
column3: The unreasonable rules were revoked.     不合理的规则被废除了。 His driving licence was revoked after the crash.     他撞车后驾驶执照被吊销了。

A satirical imitation or burlesque of the heroic manner or style.     嘲弄地模仿英雄风格的作品对英雄行为或风格的讽刺的模仿或戏谑 English poet and diplomat known for his epigrams and light satirical verse.     普赖尔&马修1664－1721英国诗人和外交官&以其机智的短诗和略带讽刺的诗闻名

Some English phrases can't be done into Chinese satisfactorily.     有些英语成语是无法满意地译成汉语。 The present system has worked satisfactorily& so why change it? My advice is to leave well alone.     目前这个制度执行情况令人满意&为什么要改变呢？我侍建议是听其自然。
The answer was not quite satisfactory to him.     这项答复未能使他完全满意。 Everything was turning out most satisfactory.     一切都非常趁心如意。

column2: a. 感到满意的 vbl. 使...满意

Just to satisfy my curiosity& how much did you pay for your car?     我只是出于好奇&请问你买这辆车花了多少钱？ Some people are very hard to satisfy.     有些人是很难使其满意的。

And now the scene shifts to the warehouse& where the murderer is lying in wait.     现在场景转到仓库&行凶者正埋伏在那里伺机行动。 Our reporter was the first person on the scene.     我们的记者是最先到达出事地点的。

column2: n. 在商店中行窃的小偷

column3: An indiscriminate shopper; indiscriminate taste in music.     无选择的购物者；在音乐上无特殊品味的 The shopper is showered with broken glass from the explosion.     炸碎的玻璃劈头盖脸地落到购物顾客的身上。
I went out on a shopping spree.     我出去疯狂地购物。 You may go grass skiing& bicycle riding& or shopping on the weekend.     周末你可以去滑草&骑脚踏车&或购物。

column2: n. 购物中心& 商店区
column3: The land is destined for a new shopping center.     这块地已被划作为营建一个新购物中心之用。 It's sad to see the old museum being taken down to make way for a new shopping center.     看着将老博物馆拆除来建新购物中心&真令人伤心。

column2: n. 岸&滨 vt. (up)支撑&支持
column3: We found many beautiful shells on the shore.     我们在岸边找到了好多美丽的贝壳。 The villagers shored up sagging huts.     村民们撑起摇摇欲坠的茅棚。
The room looked bare& shorn of its rich furnishings.     这个房间除去了豪华的家具以後& 看上去光秃秃的. He was shorn of his privileges.     他的特权被剥夺了。

column2: a. 短的&矮的 n. 短裤 adv. 短暂地；突然地&急地
column3: The driver stopped short when the children ran into the street.     小孩跑进街道时&司机猛然煞车。 He seems much shorter without his shoes on.     他没穿鞋&看上去矮多了。
The lights short-circuited when I joined up the wires.     我一接上电线&电灯就短路了。 You've short-circuited the washing-machine.     你把洗衣机弄短路了.
This is a short story whose easy style I love very much.     这是一则短篇小说&我很喜欢它那简单的笔调。 He brightened up at the mention of his son's success as a short story writer.     提到他儿子作为一个短篇小说作家是成功的&他就喜形于色。
The war was lost because of a shortage of munitions.     战争因军火不足而失败。 The company's main problem is the shortage of skilled personnel.     这家公司的主要问题是缺少有技术的人员。

column2: v. 使...不工作 vt. 使简短

column3: No matter who point out our shortcoming& we will correct them.     不管谁指出我们的缺点&我们都改正。 Donna is sensible of his shortcoming.     唐纳知道他自己的缺点。
She shortened the shirt by an inch.     她把衬衫截短了一英寸。 My teacher asked me to shorten the report to one page.     老师让我把报告缩短为一页。

An abnormal& often permanent shortening& as of muscle or scar tissue& that results in distortion or deformity& especially of a joint of the body.     挛缩一种异常且常为永久性的缩短&如肌肉或瘢痕组织&会导致扭曲或变形&特别是身体关节处 Surgical shortening or reshaping of the nose.     鼻部整形术外科手术中鼻子的整形或截短
You know how I loathe typing and shorthand.     你知道我多么讨厌打字和速记。 His farewell speech was transcribed from shorthand notes.     他的告别演说是由速记转译而成的。

column2: a. 短命的& 短暂的& 短期的& 无常的

column3: The movie was over shortly before six.     电影在六点钟不到就结束了。 She died in an accident shortly afterwards.     不久以后&她就在一次事故中丧生。
This pair of pant was converted into shorts.     这条裤子被改成了短裤。 Pants& such as blue jeans& made into shorts by cutting off part of the legs.     毛边短裤长裤&如蓝布牛仔裤&通过截去裤腿的一部分而制成的短裤
He was too shortsighted to focus on the object.     他由於近视过深而无法把视力焦点对准在该物体上。 He is shortsighted.     他是近视眼。

column2: n. 炮弹&射击&射手 v. 射击&发出&发芽 vbl. 射击&发出&发芽
column3: I heard a shot in his room.     我听到他的房间内一声枪响。 He won the golf match by two shots.     他以两杆的成绩赢得了这场高尔夫球赛。

column2: n. [体]推铅球& 铅球的一次投射

column3: A shotgun leans against the table.     桌子跟前靠着一支猎枪。 Willie accidentally lets off his father's shotgun and made a hole in the wall.     威利玩他父亲的手枪时不小心走火了& 把墙壁打出一个洞。
I knew if I kept at it I should succeed.     我知道如果我坚持下去就会成功。 You really ought to/should do something about that cough!     你咳嗽那麽厉害& 真得治一治了!

column2: n. 肩膀 v. 肩负&承担 vt. 承担&肩负
column3: The soldiers shouldered their kit and moved on.     士兵们背起行装&继续前进。 The boy had a parrot on his right shoulder.     男孩把一只鹦鹉放在右肩上。
Her wavy hair fell in loose wisps and loops upon her shoulders.     她那一头波浪般的长发一簇簇一圈圈地散垂在肩上。 The officer wears sashes on his shoulders.     这名军官的肩上佩戴着肩带。

column2: n. 呼喊&突发的大笑 v. 呼喊&高声谈笑&玩乐
column3: His news was greeted with shouts of joy.     大家都对他的消息报以欢呼。 The children on the sand were shouting with excitement.     沙滩上的孩子们兴奋得大喊大叫。

column2: n. 推&挤 v. 推挤&放置&撞
column3: He started shoving clothes into drawers.     他开始把衣服乱塞在抽屉里。 Don't try to shove all the work onto me!     别把工作都推给我！

column2: n. 铲(挖斗机&一铲的量) vt 铲(挖&舀)
column3: He put a shovel of coal on to the fire.     他往火炉里加了一铲煤。 They were shoveling food into their mouths.     他们正大口大口地往嘴里塞食物。

column2: n. 满铲(一铲的量&一锹的量)
column3: He put a shovelful of snow in Kate's bed as a practical joke.     他把一铲雪放在凯特的床上&以此来开玩笑。

column2: n. 显示&表现&表演 v. 表示&显现&展现
column3: One evening the school showed a cowboy film.     有天晚上学校放映了一部西部片。 The leader rarely shows herself in public.     这位领导她很少在公众场合露面。
For this old trouper there is still no business like show business.     对这位老剧团演员来说仍然是娱乐性行业最好。

column2: n. 阵雨&淋浴 v. 淋浴&淋湿&下骤雨
column3: Dates showered down when we shook the tree.     我们摇树时&枣子纷纷落下。 The dancer was showered with praise.     那个跳舞的人备受称赞。
Possessing or showing knowledge or intelligence; perceptive and well-informed.     有见识的&知识渊博的掌握或显示出知识或智力的；有洞察力的而且见识广的 Stop showing off in front of everybody.     别再在大伙跟前卖弄了。

column2: n. 马戏团的老板&玩杂耍的

column3: In his youth& he had shown great promise.     他在青少年时代就显得很有出息。 The girls screamed when the grisly remains of the half-eaten corpses on the screen were shown.     当屏幕上显示出尸体被吃掉一半的恐怖残骸时&女孩子们尖叫起来。

column2: n. 展览品(供展览的样品)

column3: Police restored the stolen jewels to the showroom.     警方将被盗的珠宝交还给了陈列室. Our entire range of cars is now on view at your local showroom.     我们各种型号的汽车现正在贵区陈列室里展出。
A bauble is a showy ornament of little value.     廉价珠宝是华而不实的装饰品。 A showy manner or display.     炫耀炫耀的态度或展示
As he moved threateningly forward she shrank (back) from him.     他步步逼近& 把她吓得直（向後）退缩. The dough shrank slowly in the cold air.     面团在冷空气中慢慢收缩了.

column2: n. 碎布条&细片&些少 v. 撕成碎片&变成碎片
column3: I was shredding top-secret documents at that time.     我当时正把机密文件切碎。 The jacket was torn to shreds by the barbed wire.     那件夹克让铁丝网给戳破了。
People called her shrew.     人们叫她泼妇。
He is a shrewd and sometimes ruthless adversary.     他是个精明的、有时候冷酷无情的对手。 It was a shrewd assessment and probably pretty close to the truth.     这个评估很有道理&可能相当正确。

column2: n. 尖叫&叫喊 v. 尖叫
column3: My sister gave a shriek of delight.     我妹妹高兴地尖叫起来。 She shrieked in alarm.     她惊恐地尖叫起来。

column2: n. 尖锐的声音 a. 尖锐的&刺耳的 v. 用尖锐的声音说&发出刺耳声
column3: Shrill protests about the new taxes filled the air.     广播中充斥着对新税法的尖锐抗议。 The boys broke into shrill& excited cheering.     男孩子们突然迸发出刺耳的兴奋的欢呼声。
The monkeys cry (out) shrilly when they see danger.     猴子遇到危险时尖声大叫.
Jumbo shrimp; a jumbo jet.     大虾；巨型喷气式飞机 Fruit cocktail; shrimp cocktail.     水果鸡尾酒；河虾鸡尾酒

column2: n. 圣地&神龛&庙 v. 将...置于神龛内
column3: Florence is the shrine of the Renaissance.     佛罗伦萨是文艺复兴的圣地。 A religious building of the Far East& especially a many-storied Buddhist tower& erected as a memorial or shrine.     塔&宝塔一种远东的宗教建筑&尤指一种多层的佛塔&作为纪念塔或神龛而建立

column2: n. 收缩&萎缩 v. 收缩&退缩&萎缩
column3: He had a tendency to shrink up whenever attention was focused on him.     当别人注意他时&他就会退缩一旁。 The economy is shrinking instead of growing.     经济正在萎缩而不是在增长中。

Shrinkage or contraction of the protoplasm away from the wall of a living plant or bacterial cell& caused by loss of water through osmosis.     胞质皱缩通过渗透作用由于缺水引起的活植细胞或细菌的细胞质的皱缩或收缩&并与细胞壁分离 As a result of shrinkage& the shirt is now too small to wear.     由于洗后缩小&那件衬衫现在小得不能穿了。

column2: a. 畏缩的&犹豫不决的
column3: The economy is shrinking instead of growing.     经济正在萎缩而不是在增长中。 She's no shrinking violet always ready to speak up for herself.     她可不胆小--任何场合都能为自己说话.

column2: v. 枯萎&皱缩 vi. 枯萎&干枯
column3: The leaves shriveled up in the sun.     叶子在阳光下都蔫了。 The dry air shrivels the leather.     因空气干燥皮子都皱了。

column2: n. 寿衣&覆盖物&船之横桅索 v. 包以尸衣&遮蔽&隐藏
column3: The doctor wanted us to use the sheet for a shroud.     医生想让我们用床单当裹尸布。 The whole jail was shrouded in darkness.     整座监狱笼罩在黑暗之中。
The naughty boy hid the books in the shrub.     这个淘气的孩子把书藏在了灌木丛里。 Resembling a shrub& especially in having woody stems and branches.     灌木状的类似灌木的&尤指有木质树干或树枝
A secluded mansion& islanded by shrubbery and fences.     用灌木丛和篱笆隔开的一座幽独的大宅

column2: n. 耸肩 v. 耸肩
column3: She gave a shrug and walked away.     她耸了耸肩就离开了。 I really admire the way she is able to shrug off unfair criticism.     我很佩服她能对错误的批评意见不予理会。

column2: v. 使...收缩 a. 缩拢的

column3: He must shuck off the bad habits.     他应该改掉过去的坏习惯。 It's not worth shucks.     那种东西一文不值。

column2: n. 战悚&发抖 v. 战悚&发抖
column3: She shuddered at the sight of the dead body.     她一看到死尸就战栗起来。 He shuddered with cold.     他冷得发抖。

column2: n. 拖著脚走&洗纸牌 v. 拖曳&慢吞吞地走
column3: Who is going to shuffle?     该谁洗牌了？ Don't shuffle& give me a clear answer.     别支支吾吾&给我一个明确的答复。
This recluse shunned all company.     这位隐士不与任何人来往。 His friends shunned him.     他的朋友都避开他。

column2: vt. 分路(调车&推给别人&拖延) n. 分路(转辙器&调轨)
column3: She tried to shunt the blame onto Miss Williams.     她试图把责任推至威廉姆斯小姐身上。 Can we shunt the talks onto a new topic?     我们谈话换个新话题好吧？

column2: a. 关闭的&合拢的&围绕的 v. 关上&闭起&幽禁 vbl. 关上&闭起&幽禁
column3: He shut himself away for a month to catch up on his academic work.     他与世隔绝一个月&力图把功课赶上去。 He shut his eyes to her faults.     他对她的缺点视而不见。

column2: n. 百叶窗&遮门&快门 v. 装以遮门&以百叶窗遮闭
column3: He adjusted the shutter before taking a photo.     在照相前&他调整了快门。 The shop-front is fitted with rolling shutters.     那商店的店面装有卷动门帘.

column2: n. 穿梭&往返移动之物 v. 使...穿梭移动
column3: We shuttled the passengers to the city center by helicopter.     我们来来回回地用直升机把旅客运送到市中心。 There is a shuttle service between the city center and the air station.     在市中心和飞机场之间有往返的穿梭运行班车。

column2: n. 羽毛球&玩毽子&打羽毛球 v. 互相授受&这儿那儿移动
a. 害羞的 vi. 惊退&畏缩
column3: He was too shy to talk to anyone at the party.     在晚会上他很腼腆&没有和任何人讲话。 We are still a little shy of our quota.     我们离完成定额还差一点点。

column2: 夏洛克& 狠毒无情的放高利贷者(原为莎士比亚剧作《威尼斯商人》中的犹太放高利贷者)
column3: Jacob was at his best in the role of Shylock; he did not merely act; he lived the part.     雅各布最擅长扮演夏洛克这个角色&他不仅是在演戏&而是把角色演活了。 Shylock has an itch for money.     夏洛克渴望发财。
She glanced shyly at him and then lowered her eyes.     她羞怯地偷看了他一下& 随即垂下眼帘. She cast her eyes down shyly.     她羞怯地垂下目光。
She can't get over her shyness.     她克服不掉羞怯感. Shyness inhibited him from speaking.     他因害羞而说不出话来.

column2: n. [动]合趾猴( 产于马来半岛及苏门答腊)

column3: The natural or surgical union of anatomical parts of two organisms& usually involving exchange of blood& as in the development of Siamese twins or in certain transplant operations.     联体&并体天生的或手术施行的通常进行血液交换的两器官的联合&比如在连体婴的发育或某种嫁接手术中 Siamese cats are rather like dogs in some ways.     泰国猫在某些方面相当象狗。
Cold& dry winds from Siberia prevail over the mainland from December to February.     从12月到2月&西伯利亚来的干燥冷风控制大陆。 The cold air masses are moving from Siberia towards Inner Mongolia.     冷空气团正由西伯利亚向内蒙古移动。
For long stretch of the try- siberian railway& all you see are trees.     横跨西伯利亚的铁路沿线的景色是一望无际的树林。
I have two brothers and a sister: three siblings in all.     我有两个哥哥和一个妹妹: 共有三个兄妹. Inferior craft; felt inferior to his older sibling.     低等的手工艺品；感到比他的兄妹们低一等

column2: a. sibyl 的&sibyl 性的&预言性的

column3: A peninsula of northeast Tunisia extending into the Mediterranean Sea across from Sicily.     波恩角突尼斯东北部延伸入地中海的一个半岛&在西西里岛对面

column2: a. 恶心的&有病的&腻烦的 n. 病人 vt. 呕吐
column3: Your uncle is very sick.     你的叔叔病得很厉害。 I'm sick of waiting around like this.     我腻烦像这样在一旁等著。
He has been on sick leave for some weeks& and so he has to work hard to catch us all up.     他因为请了几个星期的病假&因此不得不加紧工作来赶上我们大家。
The dog began to sicken and soon died.     这只狗开始生病并且很快就死了。 Cruelty sickens most of us.     我们大多数人都对残暴行为十分愤慨.
The car hit the child with a sickening thud.     汽车把那个孩子撞了& 发出一声可怕的闷响. Sickening or insipid in taste.     （味道上）令人作呕的&淡而无味的
There is a picture of the sickle on the flag.     旗帜上有镰刀的图案。

column2: a. 病弱的&阴沉的&无精打采的 v. 成苍白色
column3: His face was a sickly yellow.     他的脸色是一种病态的黄。 Her cheeks have a sickly pallor.     她面色苍白带有病容.
Chicken pox is a common childhood sickness.     水痘是一种常见的儿童期疾病。 Some people develop altitude sickness when climbing high mountains.     有些人在爬高山时会发生高山反应。

column2: n. 旁边&侧&方面 a. 旁的&侧的 v. 偏袒
column3: A square has four sides but a circle has no sides.     正方形有四条边&而圆形没有边。 The thief slipped away down a side street.     小偷悄悄从一条小马路溜走了。

Physical and chemical tests verify that this Recovery Device has neither radioactive pollution nor toxic side effects.     经理化检验证实：使用该器无放射性污染&对人体绝对无毒无副作用。 Medicines sometimes have unpleasant side effects.     药物有时具有令人不快的副作用。
She put some plates in the sideboard.     她往餐具柜里放了些盘子。 We keep the silver in this sideboard.     我们把金属餐具放在这个餐具柜里.
I was on the sidelines during the political crisis.     在这一政治危机时期我是目睹一切的局外人。 Actually I'm a teacher& my writing is just a sideline.     我其实是个教师&写作只是我的兼职。

A box has a top& a bottom and four sides.     盒子有顶面、 底面和四个侧面. The railways carriages containing terrorists and hostages were two hundred yards away across an open field. Both sides prepared for a long drawn-out battle of nerves.     这列载着恐怖分子和人质的火车&停在一个空旷地带对面200码外的地方。双方准备进行长时间的心理战。

The area of a fair& a carnival& a circus& or an exposition where sideshows and other amusements are located.     娱乐场&游乐场在商品交易会、狂欢节、马戏团或展览会所在地提供杂耍表演和其它娱乐活动的地方 The sideshows will fetch in the people as well.     幕间穿插的表演同样可以招徕看客。
I happened to meet him on the sidewalk.     我碰巧在人行道上碰到他。 A hedge of spectators along the sidewalk.     沿着人行道形成了一道观众障碍

column2: ad. 向傍边&斜地里&向侧面地 a. 傍边的&向侧面的
column3: "You dirty bastard& " his friend said& and tried to kick me in the groin. More by good luck than good management I turned sideways.     "你这个杂种"&他的朋友一边骂一边用脚踢我的下身。我事先并未料到&但却很幸运地躲开了。 He was thrown sideways when he heard that he had failed his exams.     他听到自己考试不及格时&非常震惊。
The army has laid siege to the city several months.     部队包围了这城市好几个月。 Joan of Arc led a large army to raise the siege of Orleans in1429.     贞德在1429年率大军解除了英军对奥尔良的围攻。

The malaria-carrying mosquito is honoured in Sierra Leone today for making the country the"white man's grave" in the past and preventing Europeans settling there.     塞拉利昂的疟蚊&由于它过去曾使这个国家成为“白人的坟墓”&使欧洲人无法在此定居&如今受到了人们的赞誉。

column2: n. 筛子&粗篮&说话轻率不能保密的人 v. 筛&滤
column3: She is sieving the rice in order to sieve out the stones.     她正在把米过筛&好把石头筛出。 We can separate the stones out with a sieve.     我们可以用一个筛子把石头分离出来。
Sift the flour before making the cake.     做蛋糕前先把面粉筛一下。 Snow sifted through the crack in the roof into the room.     雪从屋顶上的裂缝飘进屋里。

column2: n. 叹息 v. 叹息之声&渴望
column3: She looked out of the window& sighing for her lost youth.     她看着窗外&为她失去的青春而惋惜。 We all heaved a sigh of relief when we heard that they were safe.     当我们听说他们平安无事时&都松了一口气。

She sighs deeply for no conspicuous reason& yearns& suffers and looks in the air extremely sadly. This is soul.     她没有明显的理由而却深深叹息、渴望、烦闷、极端悲伤地望着天空。这就是灵魂。 She sighs deeply for no conspicuous reason& yearn& suffer and looks in the air extremely sadly. This is soul.     他没有明显的理由而却深深叹息、渴望、烦闷、极端悲伤地望着天空。这就是灵魂。

column2: n. 景观&视力&眼界 v. 看见&瞄准&观看

Enclosed is a sight draft for￡26.10.5 on Messrs. Robert& Sons& which clears off our indebtedness to you.     兹同函奉上以Robert父子公司为付款人&面额26。15英镑的即期汇票一张&用以清偿所欠贵方债务。 Payment will be made by paying your sight draft under our irrevocable letter of credit.     我们的付款方式&是以不可撤消信用状见票即付汇票支付。
They reported sighting the plane.     他们宣称看见了那架飞机. He drove straight by sighting along the center line.     他注视着中央线&驾车径直向前驶去。
Come and see the sights of London.     来看看伦敦的名胜. The sights of the city never fail to impress foreign tourists.     外国游客无一不对该市留有深刻印象.
They embarked on an orgy of sightseeing.     他们开始尽情地观光游览。 Good morning& Mr.Smith. Sightseeing is our agenda today.     早上好&史密斯先生。我们今天的日程安排是游览。

It doesn't signify& so you needn't worry about it.     这无所谓& 你不必担心. What do these marks signify?     这些符号表示什麽意思?
Make sure you read all the small print before signing.     一定要先看清小号字体印刷部分再签字. The workers were railroaded into signing the agreement.     工人们被逼着匆忙地签订了这个协议。
Shylock [To Antonio] Rest you fair& good signor; Your worship was the last man in our mouths.     夏洛克：［向安冬尼奥］您好&好先生：是哪一阵好风把尊驾吹了来啦？

The similarity between them has often been remarked on.     他们之间很相似& 这是常有人提到的事. Having such a close similarity or resemblance as to be essentially equal or interchangeable.     可互换的十分类似或相象以至于本质上相等的或能互换的
We are similarly dressed.     我们的穿着差不多。 Similarly& machines could be used to keep a check on a patient's health record and bring it up to date.     同样&机器能够检查病员的病因&并使之反应出最新情况。

A unit of currency in North Korea and South Korea.     钱朝鲜和韩国的一种货币单位 Like Mr.Perot& the77-year-old Mr.Chung is campaigning on a platform that the country's current leadership has run the economy into the ground& though it is a tough argument in South Korea& where economic growth this year is running at more than7 percent.     像佩罗先生一样&77岁的郑先生的竞选口号是：目前国家领导操之过急把经济搞得一塌糊涂。不过在南韩这种说法难以成立——该国本年经济增长超过百分之七。

The area was influenced in early times by India(particularly the Hindu culture) and China.     印度支那半岛东南亚的一个半岛&包括越南、老挝、柬埔寨、泰国、缅甸和马来西亚的大陆部分。历史上这一片地区曾受印度（尤其是印度教文化）和中国的影响 A historical region of southeast Asia on the Gulf of Tonkin& an arm of the South China Sea& now forming most of northern Vietnam. It was part of French Indochina from1887 to1946.     东京湾东南亚一历史地区&位于东京湾沿岸&为南中国海的一支。该地现在组成了越南北部的大部分地区。从1887年到1946年&这里是法属印度支那的一部分

column2: a. 苏联的&苏维埃的 n. 苏维埃

Western politicians weight the choice& but it's a false choice: the leverage doesn't exist.     西方应该毫无保留地支持苏联使其成功吗？或者西方的经济支援是否应视苏联在国内外政治行为来决定？西方政客们权衡他们的选择&可是这项选择是错误的。西方对苏联的制衡并不存在。 The US and the former Soviet Union were co-signatories of/to the treaty.     美国和前苏联都是条约的签署国.

The U.S. made the first space shuttle in the world.     美国制造了世界上第一架航天飞机。 After Apollo& NASA's leaders turned their backs on the stars and planets. They delayed or canceled astronomy and space missions& gambling the agency's future on hardware like the space shuttle and space station.     阿波罗［探测外太空火箭］过后&美国宇航局的领导放弃了对星球的探测。他们搁置或取消了天文及太空任务&而将该局的前途赌在航天飞机及太空站一类的硬件上。

After Apollo& NASA's leaders turned their backs on the stars and planets. They delayed or canceled astronomy and space missions& gambling the agency's future on hardware like the space shuttle and space station.     阿波罗［探测外太空火箭］过后&美国宇航局的领导放弃了对星球的探测。他们搁置或取消了天文及太空任务&而将该局的前途赌在航天飞机及太空站一类的硬件上。 During this exercise& the spaceship will be locked onto the other side of the space station& so that the men can move from one vehicle to the other.     这次演习中&宇宙飞船将紧紧地靠上宇航站的另一边&这样宇航员就可以从一个飞行器走到另一个飞行器上了。
The spacecraft is orbiting the moon.     宇宙飞船正绕月球飞行。 The scientists calculated when the spacecraft would reach the moon.     科学家推算出宇宙飞船抵达月球的时间。
The spaceship traveled smoothly in the universe.     太空船在宇宙里平稳地飞行。 There are five spacemen in the spaceship.     宇宙飞船里有五个飞行员。

Specified by or exhibiting four dimensions& especially the three spatial dimensions and single temporal dimension of the relativity theory.     四维的&四度空间的由四维确定或表现的&尤指三个空间维度和相对理论中的时间维度 The study of the cultural& behavioral& and sociological aspects of spatial distances between individuals.     人类空间统计学研究人与人之间空间距离的文化&行为&社会层面的学科

A group of specialized nerve cells or a localized mass of gray matter in the brain or spinal cord.     神经核一组专门的神经细胞或存在于大脑或脊髓中灰物质的局部块 A secondary area of specialized academic study& requiring fewer courses or credits than a major.     辅修专业学术研究的第二个特定领域&其要求的课程和学分比主修课要少

I can recommend the vegetable pie - it's the specialty of the house.     我推荐一道蔬菜馅饼&它是这家餐馆的名菜。 His specialty is ancient French.     他专门研究的领域是古法语。

column3: I am cooking a sponge cake with jam filling.     我在做果酱松糕。 It's a sponge.     这是一块海绵。

column2: a. 像海绵的&不坚实的
column3: There grows some spongy moss on the stone.     石头上长着一些柔软的苔藓。 Drank the fresh air; spongy earth that drank up the rain.     呼吸新鲜空气；饱浸雨水的绵软泥土

column2: n. 保证人&赞助者 v. 发起&赞助

column2: n. 发起(主办&倡议&赞助)

column2: n. 自然发生&自生&自发
a. 自发的&自然产生的
column3: She shows a spontaneous gaiety of manner.     她露出天真愉快的神态。 Spontaneous fellowship and sympathy among a number of people.     本能的友情一群人自然产生的友谊和同情

column2: ad. 自发地(自生地&自然产生地&自然地&天然地)
column3: Spontaneously igniting in air.     自燃的在空气中自发地燃烧的 I had never been spontaneously approached by a publisher and such condescension rather turned my head.     还从没有一个出版商主动来与我接洽&这种屈尊有点让我受宠若惊。

column2: n. 诳骗&愚弄&戏弄 v. 揶揄&嘲讽
column3: You've been spoofed.     你上当了.

column2: n. 线轴&缠线用的框 v. 缠绕在线轴上

column2: n. 匙&匙形的铲子 v. 以匙舀起&调情

She put a spoonful of milk in each of the two cup.     她在这两个杯子里各放了一匙牛奶。 Sprinkle a spoonful of bran onto the stew to increase the fibre content.     往炖煮的食物上加一匙麦麸&以增加其纤维含量。

column2: a. 不定时发生的&零星的
column3: Despite the sporadic disturbances the dictator was still riding high.     虽不时有骚动事件&该独裁者仍能控制局势。

column2: ad. 偶发地& 零星地
n.孢子 n. 户外运动&游戏&娱乐 v. 游戏&炫耀
column3: Mushroom's spores are usually carried on the wind.     蘑菇的孢子通常由风传播。 The seed pod suddenly snapped apart& threw the spore into the air to be distributed by the wind.     心皮突然爆开&将孢子抛到空中&再由风将它们撒布开去。

column2: n. 运动&游戏&娱乐 a. 运动的&户外穿戴的 v. 游戏&戏弄&炫耀
column3: Football is my favorite sport.     足球是我最喜欢的运动。 Sport is being debased by commercialism.     体育运动的价值受商业化的影响而逐渐下降。

column2: a. 喜好运动的&运动用的&冒险性的
column3: The cup final is an important date in the sporting calendar.     足总杯决赛在运动日程表中是个重要日子。 Illness has curtailed her sporting activities.     她因病而减少了体育活动。
He is a sports buff.     他是一个体育运动爱好者。 The new sports model achieved 100 miles an hour in road tests.     这种新型号赛车於道路测试中时速达100英里.
Were I rich enough& I would buy a sports car.     如果我有足够的钱&我就买一辆赛车了。 The company is bringing out a new sports car.     公司正在生产一种新跑车.

This footballer is a sportsman who likes to be in the spotlight.     这个足球运动员是个爱出风头的运动员。 It goes without saying that a real sportsman will never dream of cheating in a game.     不用说&一个真正的运动员绝不会梦想在比赛时作弊。
She was designated sportswoman of the year.     她被指定为本年度的体坛明星。

column2: a. 象运动员的(花哨的)
column3: She's very sporty.     她非常爱好文体活动.

column2: n. 污点&地点&斑点 a. 当场的&现实买卖的 v. 污点&认出&用灯光照射
column3: Spain is our favorite holiday spot.     西班牙是我们喜欢的度假地点。 They were spotted by police as they were entering the bank.     他们走进银行时被警察认出来了。

column2: a. 无脏污的&无缺点的&无可挑剔的
column3: He keeps his house spotless.     他把家收拾得很整洁。 She keeps a spotless reputation.     她保持着清白的名声。

column2: n. 照明灯&车头灯 公众注意中心
column3: This footballer is a sportsman who likes to be in the spotlight.     这个足球运动员是个爱出风头的运动员。 There are many spotlights on the stage.     舞台上有很多聚光灯。
The leopard cannot change its spots.     【谚】江山易改&本性难移。 Did you feel a few spots of rain?     下了几滴雨&你感觉到了吗？

column2: a. 有斑点的&斑纹的&弄污了的
column3: He spotted his reputation by lying repeatedly.     他因反复说谎而败坏了自己的名声。 They were spotted by police as they were entering the bank.     他们走进银行时被警察认出来了。

column2: a. 遍处斑点的&遍处污点的&发疹的
n. 配偶 vt. 和...结婚
column3: Job is available for spouse on campus and in the community.     校园里和社区里有配偶可做的工作。 Financial provision or adjustment of property rights ordered by a court for a spouse or child in divorce proceeding.     法院命令的&为离婚诉讼中一方配偶或孩子进行的经济上的提供或对财产权的调整。

column2: n. 喷口 v. 喷出&装腔作势说出&典押
column3: Water is spouting out of the pipe.     水正从管子里喷出来。 The spout of the teapot is jammed by tea.     茶壶的壶口被茶叶堵住了。
The doctor ordered the man who had sprained his ankle to keep quiet a few days.     医生命令那扭伤足踝的人静养几天。 My sprained ankle has been acting up badly all week.     我的脚扭伤了& 整整难受了一个星期.
New buildings sprang up like bamboo shoots after a spring rain.     新的建筑物如雨后春笋般大批出现。 The soldier sprang at the enemy.     士兵猛扑向敌人。

column2: vi. 躺卧(蔓延) n. 躺卧(蔓延)
column3: He lay in a sprawl over the desk.     他手脚摊开趴在书桌上。 They were sprawled out in front of the fire.     他们摊开手脚烤火。

column2: n. 水沫&喷雾器 v. 喷雾&扫射&喷射
column3: He sprayed paint on the wall.     他把漆喷在墙上。 The gangsters sprayed the car with machinegun bullets.     匪徒们用机枪狂扫汽车。

column2: n. 传布&伸展 a. 扩延的 v. 传布&推广&伸出
column3: We spread butter on bread.     我们把奶油涂到面包上。 A wide stretch of land spread in front of us.     展现在我们面前的是一片广阔的土地。
What can we do to prevent the disease spreading?     我们能做什么来防止这种疾病蔓延呢？ Television has become an important vehicle for spreading political ideas.     电视已成为传播政治思想的重要媒介。

A program that allows a user to perform work on a computer(in contrast to a program that performs overhead functions& such as an operating system). Examples are database managers& spreadsheets& and accounting programs.     使用户在计算机上完成工作的程序（不同于那种执行内务功能的程序&如操作系统）。例如数据库管理程序、数据表程序以及会计程序等等。 In computer programming& a combined database management& spreadsheet and graphics package.     在计算机程序设计中&一种兼有数据库管理、电子报表和绘图功能的组合程序。参阅spreadsheet。
Let's have a spree.     让我们痛痛快快乐一乐。 I went out on a shopping spree.     我出去疯狂地购物。

column2: n. 小树枝&图钉 v. 折取小树枝&用钉子钉上
column3: He decorated the chicken with sprigs of parsley.     他用欧芹的嫩枝点缀在鸡上。
The patient smiled when he heard the sprightly music on the radio.     听到收音机里传来的轻快乐曲&这个病人笑了。 A usually sprightly or mischievous or sometimes spiteful person.     恶作剧的人&狡诈的人&恶毒的人通常活泼的或恶作剧的或怀有恶意的人

column2: n. 春天&弹簧&跳跃&泉水 a. 春天的 v. 弹起&弹出&跳&裂开
column3: The cat made a spring at the mouse.     猫向老鼠扑去。 A suspicion sprang up in his mind.     他的脑中突然产生了一些疑问。

The college debating society was a natural springboard for her career in politics.     大学里的辩论社自然成了她从政的跳板。 Leaping is usually done with a springboard that catapults the performer high into the air.     跳跃运动通常利用能使表演者高高地弹入空中的跳板。
I like springtime best of all.     我最喜欢春天。 The springtime of life; youth.     人生的初期；青春
A light springy jump or leap& especially on one foot.     （犹指单脚）轻快地一蹦或一跳 The turf felt springy under their feet.     他们走在草皮上&觉得很松软。
It sprinkled that evening.     那天晚上下了小雨。 We covered the cakes with chocolate sprinkles.     我们给蛋糕洒上巧克力末。
A container with small holes in the top for sprinkling ground pepper.     胡椒瓶一种顶部有很多倒胡椒粉小孔的容器 The ceremony of sprinkling the altar& clergy& and congregation with holy water.     洒圣水礼用圣水泼洒圣坛、教士及教众的仪式

column2: n. 短距离赛跑 v. 奋力而跑 斯普林特(财富500强公司之一&总部所在地美国&主要经营电讯)
column3: He sprinted past the other runners just before reaching the tape.     他在到达终点之前全速冲刺& 超越了其他赛跑者. You'll have to sprint if you want to catch the train.     你要想赶上火车& 就得快跑几步.
I wasn't claiming that Bob was a world-class sprinter& but he could show his heels to you anyway.     我并非声称鲍勃是一个世界级的短跑运动员&但不管怎样&他会把你远远甩在后面的。 He is more a sprinter than a swimmer.     他是短跑健将&而不是游泳选手。

The little girl is so lovely that I call her a sprite.     这个小女孩太可爱了&我把她叫做小精灵。 A water sprite of German mythology& usually in human form or half-human and half-fish.     水中精灵德国民间传说中的水妖&一般说它象人形或一半象人&一半象鱼

column2: n. 芽&萌芽 v. 使发芽&长芽
column3: Leaves began to sprout from the trees.     树上开始长叶子了。 These potatoes have begun to sprout.     这些马铃薯开始发芽了。

column2: n. 虎尾枞属的植物&赤松 a. 颇为干净的&俏的&时髦的 v. 使显干净&装样子
column3: Spruce and pine are evergreen trees.     云杉和松树都是常绿树木。 They all spruced up for the party.     他们打扮得漂漂亮亮去参加聚会。
He is sprung from noble ancestors.     他出身名门。 Something rather odd has sprung up.     发生了一桩相当奇怪的事。
Dancers spun in a swirl of skirts.     跳舞的人旋转著& 裙子也不停地打转. The little paper boat was caught in an eddy and spun round and round in the water.     小纸船卷进了漩涡中&在水中直打转。
Spunk up before the public at least.     至少你要在公众面前打起精神来。· Spunk up& everything will be all right.     别恢心&一切都会好起来的。

column2: n. 马刺 v. 刺激&激励
column3: He dug in his spurs.     他用靴刺踢马。 What spurred her to do that?     是什么促使她那么干的？
Characterized by adulteration; spurious.     掺假的以掺假为特征的；伪造的 Spurious writings& especially writings falsely attributed to biblical characters or times.     伪经伪造的经文&尤指假托圣经人物或圣经时代所写的经文

column2: v. 拒绝&摈弃 vt. 轻蔑地拒绝&唾弃
column3: I spurn your offer.     我拒绝你的提议。 Carl had been from his childhood a ball of fortune to spurn at.     自从童年时起卡尔就一直是一个被命运跑踢来踢去的球&饱经沧桑。

column2: vt. 喷出(短促突然的爆发&短时间) n. 喷出(短促突然的爆发&短时间)
column3: The wound was spurting blood.     伤口淌著血. The volcano spurted (out) molten lava.     火山喷出了熔岩.

column2: n. 前苏联人造地球卫星
v. 喷溅&发出噼啪声&语无伦次地说
n. 间谍&侦探&侦察 v. 侦探&找出
column3: It's wrong to spy into people's affairs.     刺探他人的私事是错误的。 The police had captured a foreign spy.     警方抓获了一名外国间谍。

column2: vt. 争论(搞乱) n. 争论(搞乱)
column3: I hate to squabble with my wife about money.     我厌恶为钱的事兴太太争吵。 No man will squabble over a nickel.     没有人会为了五分钱而吵架。
At two the squad fell out.     两点钟时这个班解散了。 A short& rehearsed jingle or phrase& shouted in unison by a squad of cheerleaders.     欢呼一小队啦啦队员齐声喊的短促、反复的音韵或短语

column2: n. 骑兵营&分遣队&小舰队

A cheap or squalid theater.     跳蚤窝低劣的或肮脏的剧院 A squalid or filthy condition.     肮脏污秽或肮脏的状态

column2: n. 狂风&暴风雪&哇哇器声 v. 狂风吹袭&哇哇地叫嚷
column3: It is said that the squall will come tomorrow.     据说暴风雪明天就要来了。 The squall speedily blew over.     风暴很快平息下来了。
There is indescribable squalor in those books.     那些书简直污秽不堪。
He has squandered all his savings on drink.     他把存的钱全买酒喝了。 Don't squander your affection on him& he'll never love you.     不要把感情浪费在他身上&他是永远不会爱你的。

column2: n. 正方形&街区&平方 a. 正方形的&正直的&公正的 v. 一致&符合&使...成方形 n. 广场

The music for a square dance.     四对男女跳的方形舞曲

column2: ad. 成方形地&正直地 ad.直接了当的、不含糊的、诚实的
column3: He faced me squarely across the table.     他在桌子那边正对著我。 This recent tragedy has put the manufacturersof the drug squarely in the dock.     新近发生的这一悲惨事件使药品厂商受到指控.

column2: a. 似方形的&有点方的
n. 壁球&摺皱不堪&拥挤嘈杂的人群 v. 压扁&变扁&压制 n. 南瓜
column3: He sat on his hat and squashed it flat.     他坐在自己的帽子上&把它压扁了。 The cat got run over by the lorry and squashed.     那只猫被卡车碾死了。

column2: n. 蹲 a. 蹲著的&矮胖胖的 v. 蹲下&坐
column3: Can you find somewhere to squat?     你找个地方坐下好吗? The old man squatted down by the fire.     老人蹲在炉火旁。

column2: n. 吱吱声 v. 吱吱叫&咬
column3: Somebody's squeaked!     有人告密了! These new shoes squeak.     穿上这双新鞋走起路来嘎吱嘎吱的.

column2: v.&n. 长而尖的叫声 vi. 发出长声尖叫
column3: He squealed like a pig.     他像猪似的号叫著. The pigs were squealing.     猪在尖叫.

column2: n. 压榨&挤 v. 紧握&挤
column3: It was a tight squeeze but we finally got all the clothes into the case.     箱子已经很满了&但我们还是把衣服全塞进去了。 We managed to get all the luggage into the car but it was a tight squeeze.     我们总算把行李都塞进汽车里了& 不过挤得要命.

column2: vi. 压扁(发出格喳格喳声) n. 格喳格喳声(静噪电路)
column3: The army get bogged down in the thick squelch mud.     军队都陷入泥沼中&行进时烂泥扑哧作声。 She squelched along the muddy path.     她沿着泥泞小径格吱格吱地走。
Squid prepared as food.     食用乌贼用作食物的乌贼 I've never eaten squid before& but I'll give it a whirl.     我以前从没吃过鱿鱼&不过我想尝一尝。

column2: n. 斜视眼&斜著 a. 斜视的 v. 使变斜视眼&斜视
column3: The bottle-top has been screwed on squint.     瓶盖没拧正。 He squinted in the bright sunlight.     他在很亮的阳光下眯起了眼睛。
What the squire said is absolutely nonsense!     这个乡绅的话纯属一派胡言！ The living is in the gift of the squire.     地主有安排牧师奉禄之权。

column2: vi. (因不舒适、羞愧或紧张而)蠕动
column3: He was squirming (around) on the floor in agony.     他躺在地上痛苦地扭动著. It made him squirm to think how he'd messed up the interview.     他想到面试时自己表现得那麽差劲儿& 心里真不是滋味儿.
The squirrel is a lovely small animal.     松鼠是一种可爱的小动物。 The squirrel hoards up nuts for the winter.     松鼠储藏坚果以防冬天。

column2: v. 喷出&溅迸&注射 n. 水枪&注射器&喷出
column3: He's such a little squirt.     他年纪不大&傲气不小。 Water squirted (from the tap) all over me.     （龙头里的）水喷了我一身.

column2: v.&n. 刺&戳 vt. 刺(伤)
column3: She stabbed him in the leg with a kitchen knife.     她拿菜刀捅伤了他的腿. The killer stabbed him with a knife/stabbed a knife into him.     凶手用刀刺他.

column2: v. 刺伤(企图&把墙凿粗糙)
column3: The police are worried about the increase in the number of stabbings in the city.     市内利器伤人案增多& 警方甚感忧虑. You'll never mend your car like that let me have a stab at it.     你这样怎麽能修好汽车--让我来试试吧.

The government has taken a measure to maintain the stability of prices.     政府已经采取了措施以确保物价稳定。 To sum up& only when strict punishment can be imposed on the lawless& can social stability be maintained.     总之&唯有当严刑峻罚加之于违法之徒时&才能维持社会安定。
He can now ride his bike without stabilizers.     他现在骑自行车不需要平衡器了. His condition has now stabilized.     他的情况稳定下来了.

The pod of this plant& containing a sweet edible pulp and seeds that yield a gum used as a stabilizer in food products.     角豆荚角豆植物的豆荚&内含味甜可食的肉质部分以及种子&它们产生出一种胶&可用于食品中做稳定剂 He can now ride his bike without stabilizers.     他现在骑自行车不需要平衡器了.

column2: a. 稳定的&安定的 n. 马厩&马棚
column3: This ladder isn't very stable.     这架梯子不太牢靠。 He is a bit neurotic& but his wife is a very stable person.     他有点神经质&但他的妻子是一个非常稳重的人。

column2: a. 断续的 ad. 不连贯地
n. 堆叠&堆 v. 堆积&做牌&选派
column3: There is a stack of dishes to be washed in the kitchen.     厨房里还有一大堆盘子要洗。 Traffic was stacked up for miles because of the accident.     车祸引起了交通堵塞&车辆排起的长龙有好几里长。
We will go to the stadium to watch a football match.     我们将去体育场观看足球比赛。 Keep on past the church; the stadium is about half a mile further on.     一直向前走过了教堂&约莫半英里就是体育场。

column2: n. 全体人员&同事 n. 杆&棒 vt. 配备员工
column3: Most of our offices are staffed by volunteers.     在我们大多数办公室任职的是志愿人员。 When climbing a mountain I advise beginners to use a staff.     我建议刚开始爬山的人使用拐杖。

He stole out of the house without anyone seeing him.     他悄悄地溜出了房子&没有人看见他。 He was sent into prison for stealing.     他由于偷窃被送入监狱。

column2: n. 秘密行动&秘密&鬼祟
column3: Tracking wild animals requires great stealth.     跟踪野生动物必须悄然无声。 The burglars had entered the house by stealth.     窃贼偷偷进入那所房子。
In secret; stealthily.     秘密地；偷偷地

column2: n. 蒸气&精力 a. 蒸气的 v. 蒸发
column3: The engines are driven by steam.     这些发动机是由蒸汽驱动的。 The ship steamed into the harbor.     船驶入了港湾。

It is said that James Watt's observation of steam issuing from a kettle gave birth to the idea of the steam engine.     据说&詹姆斯·瓦特对水壶蒸气的观察使他产生了发明蒸汽机的想法。 In1768 the first steam engine appeared.     在1768年出现了第一部蒸汽机。
They traveled on the steamboat along the coast.     他们坐着小汽船沿着海岸旅行。 Some passengers are sitting on the deck of the large steamboat chatting.     有些旅客正坐在这只大轮船的甲板上聊天。
He steamed the stamp off the envelope.     他用蒸汽把信封上的邮票揭下来。 The ship steamed into the harbor.     船驶入了港湾。
The steamers for Shanghai leave on Wednesday.     开往上海的轮船星期三启程。 We'll ship the goods at an early time as long as there is a steamer.     只要有船&我们就尽早装货。
Some passengers are sitting on the deck of the large steamboat chatting.     有些旅客正坐在这只大轮船的甲板上聊天。 A steamship with the bow and upper deck rounded so as to shed water.     鲸背甲板船一种蒸汽船&带有圆形的船头和上甲板以遮蔽雨水

We were stifling in that hot room with all the windows closed.     我们在那间关著窗户的热屋子里& 简直透不过气来. The atmosphere in the crowded hall became so stifling that two of the women passed out.     拥挤不堪的大厅里闷得令人窒息&两个妇女晕了过去。

I think they should make some stiles for people to cross the wall.     我认为他们应该建些梯磴好让人们跨过墙去。 A poor man came to the door and asked for money for a cup of tea yesterday. My mother& always happy to help a lame dog over a stile& invited him in for a meal.     昨天&有位穷人来到我家门口想讨点钱去喝杯茶&我母亲总是乐于助人于危难之中&请他进屋吃了一顿饭。

column2: a. 兴奋性的&激励的&鼓舞的 n. 兴奋剂&酒精性饮料
column3: It is hoped that the tax cuts will act as a stimulant to further economic growth.     希望降低税率这一措施能刺激经济进一步增长。 Coffee and tea are mild stimulants.     咖啡和茶都是温和的兴奋剂。
I hoped my warning would stimulate her to greater efforts.     我希望我的告诫会促使她作出更大的努力。 Light stimulates plant growth.     光会刺激植物生长。
The exhibition stimulated interest in the artist's work.     这次展览引起人们对这位艺术家的作品的兴趣. She was stimulated into new efforts.     她受到鼓励&重新作出努力。

column2: a. 刺激的&有刺激性的
column3: He looks sharp. Working with him shall be stimulating.     他看起来精明。和他一起工作应该够刺激的。 They use television advertising as a device for stimulating demand.     他们利用电视广告作为刺激需求的方法。

Stimulation of the mind or emotions to a high level of feeling or activity.     鼓舞使人的心灵或情感受到刺激而达到更高层次情感和行动的东西 The joy and moral stimulation of work no longer must be forgotten in the mad chase of evanescent profits.     务必不能再忘记劳动带来的喜悦和激励&而去疯狂地追逐那转瞬即逝的利润。

The nutrient in the soil acts as a stimulus to growth.     土壤中的养分能促进植物生长。 Her words of praise were a stimulus for people to work harder.     她赞扬的话鼓舞人们工作更努力。

column2: n. 刺&讽刺 v. 刺&长著刺&使苦恼

The quality or state of being selfish or stingy.     自私&吝啬自私或吝啬的品质或状况 A stingy person; a miser.     吝啬吝啬小气的人；守财奴

A stipulation or qualification& especially a clause in a document or an agreement.     条款一种规定或条件&尤其是指一个文件或协议中的条文 May I refer you to the contract stipulation about packing(or shipping..)?     请您看看合同中有关包装（装运）的规定。

column3: Your first surmise was right.     你第一次猜得对。 We surmised that he must have had an accident.     我们猜想他一定出事了。
I think most of these obstacles can be surmounted.     我认为这些障碍大多数都是可以克服的。 Hard to traverse& climb& or surmount.     难攀登的&陡峭的难以通过、攀登或克服的
What is your surname?     你的姓是什么？ Just call me by my surname& cut out the Mr.     就叫我的姓吧&去掉先生二字。
Men surpass women in strength.     男人比女人力气大。 Effort or ambition to equal or surpass another.     竞争&好胜心争取赶上或超过另一个的努力或野心

column2: a. 多余的&过剩的 n. 过剩&剩余物&盈余&顺差
column3: We are giving away all our surplus apples.     我们准备把多余的苹果全部送人。 Mexico has a large surplus of oil.     墨西哥有大量过剩的石油。

column2: n. 惊奇 v. 使惊奇
column3: It was a pleasant surprise to learn of her marriage.     得知她结婚是件令人惊喜的事。 The news greatly surprised them.     这消息使他们大为吃惊。

column2: a. 感到惊讶的 vbl. 感到惊讶
column3: In fact I'm rather surprised you haven't done so already.     你还没有这样做&我实在感到惊讶。 The news greatly surprised them.     这消息使他们大为吃惊。
It's surprising: they lost!     他们竟然失败了&真没想到！ Well& that's very surprising.     唷&这真是叫人吃惊。
Swans are surprisingly awkward on land.     天鹅在陆地上笨得出奇. He's surprisingly sprightly for an old man.     他这把年纪了& 还这麽精神& 真了不起.

column2: a. 不现实的&梦幻的&怪异的&可怕的
column3: Meeting you here like this is positively surreal!     像这样与你在此相逢真好比一场梦! Under the influence of the drug my mind was filled with surreal images.     我受了麻醉药的刺激& 头脑里充满了稀奇古怪的幻觉.
The lexicon of surrealist art.     超现实主义艺术的词汇
They surrendered to the enemy.     他们向敌人投降了。 We would rather die than surrender.     我们宁死而不投降。

column2: a. 鬼鬼祟祟的&保密的
column3: Characterized by stealth; surreptitious.     秘密的偷偷摸摸的；鬼鬼祟祟的 His surreptitious behaviour naturally aroused suspicion.     他那鬼鬼祟祟的行为自然引起了旁人的怀疑。

column2: n. <美>(四轮双座通常有篷的)萨里式游览马车
column3: The girl went to the museum by a surrey.     那个女孩坐着一辆四轮双座轻便马车去博物馆了。 Surrey scored only200 runs and had to follow on.     萨里只得了200分&只好继续击球。

column2: n. 代理&代理人&代用品
column3: Fiction is a poor surrogate for real experience.     小说中的事远逊於实际体验.

column2: n. 环绕物 v. 包围&环绕
column3: We are surrounded by dangers.     我们的处境危机四伏。 Trees surround the pond.     树木围绕著池塘.

column2: a. 周围的 n. 环境&周围的事物
column3: The surrounding villages have been absorbed by/into the growing city.     周围的村庄已经并入了那不断扩展的城市. Gradually the surrounding farmland turned residential.     周围的农田渐渐变成了住宅区。
Animals in zoos are not in their natural surroundings.     动物园里的动物不是生活在自然环境中。 We are living in pleasant surroundings.     我们生活在舒适的环境中。
The act of observing closely or the condition of being closely observed; surveillance.     密切注视密切注视的行为或被密切注视的状态；监视 The act or a period of observing; surveillance.     观察；警戒观察或监视的行为或时间

column2: n. 纵览&视察&测量 v. 审视&视察&通盘考虑&调查
column3: We stood on the top of the mountain and surveyed the countryside.     我们站在山顶上&眺望乡村。 This survey is the work of a real professional.     这份调查是真正内行人做的.

A line established by sighting in surveying a tract of land.     横断线在测量一块土地时通过目视确定的线 An instrument used in surveying& consisting of100 linked pieces of iron or steel and measuring66 feet(20.1 meters).     测链测量用的一种工具&包含有100个相连的钢铁环&长66英尺（20。1米）

A small flag for marking a position& used especially by surveyors or soldiers.     测量旗用来标记位置的小旗&尤用于测量员或战士 The surveyor went over the house thoroughly and advised us not to buy it.     房屋鉴定人彻底察看了房子以後& 劝我们不要买.
That fashion is a survival from the 1930s.     那种时装是三十年代的遗风。 The miraculous survival of some people in the air crash was widely reported by the press.     空难事件中有些人大难不死被新闻界广泛报导。
The human race cannot survive.     人类不能继续生存。 In the jungle& they were driven to extremes in order to survive.     在丛林中& 他们为了生存被迫采取极端行动.
He is the only survivor of the plane crash.     他是那次飞机失事唯一的幸存者。 The sole survivor of the crash was a little boy.     这次撞车事故的唯一幸存者是一个小男孩。
Susan is in a thoughtful mood.     苏珊心事重重。 Susan seems very quiet& but make no mistake (about it)& she has a terrible temper!     苏珊样子很文静& 可别产生误会& 她脾气坏极了!

Susceptibility to bribery or corruption& as in the use of a position of trust for dishonest gain.     甘受贿赂&贪污腐化易受贿赂或腐败的影响性&如在使用不诚实的收益的信托状况时 The state of being predisposed; tendency& inclination& or susceptibility.     倾向倾向于…的状态；趋势；倾向或敏感性

column2: n. 易受影响者&易受感染者 a. 易受影响的&易感动的&容许
column3: The plant is not susceptible to disease.     这种植物不容易受病害侵袭。 He's so susceptible that she easily gained his affection.     他易受感情影响&所以她很轻易就得到了他的爱。

column2: n. 嫌疑犯 a. 令人怀疑的&不可信的 v. 怀疑&猜想
column3: She has more intelligence than we suspected her to possess.     她的智慧比我们猜想的要高。 They suspected an ambush.     他们怀疑有埋伏。

column2: v. 推迟&悬(浮)&挂&暂停&取消 vi. 吊&悬浮 vt. 悬&挂&吊&暂停&中止
column3: The policeman was suspended while the complaint was investigated.     因该警察遭投诉&在调查期间已令其暂停职务。 A curved or sharply bent device& usually of metal& used to catch& drag& suspend& or fasten something else.     钩呈曲线形或急剧弯曲的金属装置&用于抓、拉、挂或固定其他东西
His license was suspended for six months.     他的执照被吊销6个月。 The driver's certificate was suspended by the police.     这个司机的驾驶执照被警察吊销了。

column2: n. 吊的人&袜吊&吊裤带
column3: Some boys wear suspenders to keep their trousers up.     有些孩子使用背带来吊住裤子。
Don't keep us in suspense any longer!     别再让我们着急了！ We waited in great suspense for the doctor's diagnosis.     我们焦急万分地等候医生做出诊断。
The headmaster has made a decision of suspension of a pupil from school.     校长已经做出对一名学生停学处分的决定。 She appealed against her suspension.     她对被停职一事已经上诉。
And the suspension bridge from hanging vines.     悬索桥受到了悬挂着的藤的启发。
The talks have resulted in a lessening of suspicion.     谈话消减了彼此的怀疑。 They had an uneasy suspicion that all was not well.     他们有一种令人不安的猜疑&所有的事都不太妙。
His strange behavior made the police suspicious.     他不寻常的举止引起了警察的怀疑。 Two suspicious characters were brought in.     逮捕了两名嫌疑犯.
The customs officer inspected my passport suspiciously.     海关官员颇为怀疑地检查了我的护照. The aforementioned (person/persons) was/were acting suspiciously.     前面所述的人行动可疑.

column2: v. 承受&支持&经受&维持
column3: The foundations were not strong enough to sustain the weight of the house.     这地基不够牢固&无法承受房屋的重量。 Hope alone sustained him in his struggle.     在奋斗中&只有希望支持着他。

column2: a. 持久的&经久不衰的
column3: A system of physical conditioning designed to enhance circulatory and respiratory efficiency that involves vigorous& sustained exercise& such as jogging& swimming& or cycling& thereby improving the body's utilization of oxygen.     有氧健身法旨在增强循环和呼吸功效的生理调节体系&包括有力的、持久的锻炼&例如慢跑、游泳或骑自行车&从而提高肌体对氧气的利用 The court sustained his claim that the contract was illegal.     法庭确认他的要求正当&宣布该合同不合法。
She is weak from lack of sustenance.     她因缺乏营养而虚弱。 There's not much sustenance in a glass of orange squash.     一杯橙汁饮料没有什么营养。

column2: n. 缝合&缝合处&缝合用的线 v. 缝合
a. 苗条的& 体态娇美的

column3: Little Tom swabbed up the gravy with crusty bread.     小汤姆用硬面包把肉汁抹得干干净净。

column2: n. 摇动(松垂&挠度&洼地) vt 摇动(松垂&挠度&洼地)

column3: Don't swagger (around) just because you got the job.     别因为得到了这份工作就得意忘形. He took his prize and swaggered back to his seat.     他领奖後洋洋得意地回到自己的座位上.

column2: n. 情郎&乡下的年轻人
n. 燕子 vt. 吞下&咽下&忍受 vi. 咽口水
column3: She was swallowed up by the crowd and we lost sight of her.     她淹没在人群之中&我们看不到她了。 There are many swallows flying in the sky.     天空中有许多燕子。
As he swam& he thrashed the water with his hand.     他游泳时用手拍打水。 Swam downriver; a downriver canoe race.     向下游游泳；顺流独木舟赛

column2: n. 沼泽&湿地 v. 淹没&陷于沼泽
column3: The heavy rain has turned the small garden into a swamp.     大雨使这小花园变成了一块沼泽地。 In the swamp we were beset by mosquitoes.     我们在沼泽地受到蚊子的围攻。

column2: a. 沼泽的&沼泽多的&湿地的
column3: Full of or resembling mire; swampy.     沼泽般的充满了淤泥的或似沼泽的；泥沼的 Low& flat& swampy land; a bog or marsh.     沼泽低平的沼泽地；泥塘或湿地

column2: n. 天鹅 vi. 闲荡&游荡
column3: A black swan is rare.     黑天鹅很稀有。 The swan sings when death comes.     死期来到&天鹅歌声美妙。
Don't be such a swank!     别那麽招摇! She's swanking just because they said her essay was the best.     皆因人称她的文章最好& 她就忘乎所以了.

column2: 斯旺西[英国威尔士南部港市](西格拉摩根郡首府)
column3: A borough of southern Wales west-northwest of Cardiff. It is an industrial port on Swansea Bay& an inlet of the Bristol Channel. Population& 188&500.     斯旺西威尔士南部市镇&位于卡迪夫西北偏西。是布里斯托尔海峡的小海湾斯旺西湾的一个工业港口。人口188&500

column2: v.&n. 交换 vt. 交换&用...作交易
column3: As you like my dress and I like yours& shall we do a swap?     既然你喜欢我的连衣裙而我也喜欢你的&咱们交换好吗？ They swapped (ie told each other) stories about their army days.     他们互相讲述了他们在军队中的经历.

column2: n. 蜂窝 v. 云集、充满
column3: He has received a swarm of letters.     他已经收到了一大批信件。 The crowd swarmed out of the cinema after the film ended.     电影结束后&人们从电影院蜂拥而出。

column2: 分蜂群 群飞 分蜂 群居
column3: The crowd was swarming out through the gates.     人群一窝蜂地从出口涌出. The beach was swarming with bathers.     海滩上挤满了游泳的人.
She has a swarthy complexion.     她的肤色黝黑。
The farmer cut a swathe in the field with his scythe.     农夫用镰刀在地里刈出一条路来。

column2: n. 摇&影响力&支配 v. 使摇动&支配
column3: His power sways the world.     他称霸天下。 The branches of the trees were swaying in the wind.     树枝在风中摇晃。
They swore an oath to carry out their duties faithfully.     他们发誓要忠实履行自己的职责。 I swore her to secrecy about what I had told her.     我要她起誓对我告诉她的事保守秘密。
I really sweated over my last essay.     我的确下功夫写了上次那篇文章。 I am sweating all over.     我浑身上下大汗淋漓。

column2: n. (运动时系在额上或手腕上的)吸汗巾

column3: I had to put on a sweater since it was raining hard outside.     外面在下雨&我不得不套上一件厚运动衫。 This sweater washes well.     这件套头毛衣耐洗.

column2: n. 血汗工厂(工作条件恶劣而工资低的)
a. 汗流浃背的&热得令人发汗的
n. 瑞典人 n. 瑞典甘蓝&一种黄色大头菜
column3: He is a Swede.     他是瑞典人。 The Swede would answer with pride: "Both& sir! " For many days this practice continued.     瑞典人会骄傲地答道：“两次&长官。”这样的练习进行了好多天。
He was born in Sweden.     他出生于瑞典。 Sweden has frontiers with Norway and Finland.     瑞典与挪威和芬兰接壤。

column2: n. 瑞典人&瑞典语 a. 瑞典的&瑞典人的&瑞典语的
column3: She can understands Swedish quite well.     她懂瑞典语。 Swedish director whose critically acclaimed films& such as The Silence(1963) and Fanny and Alexander(1983)& are characterized by slow pace& laconic dialogue& and heavy use of symbolism to explore the psychological states of the characters.     伯格曼&英马尔生于1918瑞典导演&其受到评论界赞扬的电影&如沉默（1963年）和芬尼和亚历山大（1983年）&其特点是慢节奏、对话简洁和大量运用象征手法以揭示人物的心理状态

column2: n. 扫除&席卷&范围 v. 扫除&用手指弹&掠过
column3: She swept the floor clean.     她把地板打扫干净。 This floor needs a good sweep.     这地板需要好好清扫一下。
I want to buy a carpet sweeper.     我想买一台地毯清扫器。 She is a pavement sweeper.     她是一个打扫人行道的清扫工人。

column2: n. 扫除&废屑 a. 一扫而去的&凶猛的&广泛的 vbl. 扫除&打扫
column3: The streets have been swept free of leaves.     街上的落叶已打扫乾净. Such evil practice cannot be swept away at once.     这种坏事不是一下能扫除干净的。

column2: a. 甜的&可爱的&悦耳的 n. 糖果&甜点
column3: The dish tastes a bit sweet.     这菜有点儿甜味。 The dentist told the boy not to eat too many sweets.     牙医告诫这男孩不要吃太多糖果。
Shall I sweeten your coffee?     我给你的咖啡加点糖好吗？ A good meal sweetened his temper.     吃了一顿好饭&他的脾气变得好多了。

column2: n. 使变甜的东西&甜味剂
column3: The firm offers her a generous bonus as a sweetener.     公司提出给她一笔可观的花红藉以拉拢她。 Love and scandal is the best sweetener of tea.     恋爱与丑闻&是喝茶的最佳甜点心。
Containing& full of& or sweetened with honey.     多蜜液的含有蜜的&充满了蜜或因蜜变甜的 Shall I sweeten your coffee?     我给你的咖啡加点糖好吗？

column2: n. 情人&爱人 v. 爱慕&求爱
column3: His sweetheart is a pretty girl.     他的情人是一个可爱的女孩。 A favored female companion or sweetheart.     女朋友最喜欢的女性同伴或爱人
The nightingale sings sweetly at night.     这只夜莺夜里唱得很好听。 The choir sang sweetly& and none more so than the Welsh boy.     唱诗班唱得很悦耳&尤其是没人比得上那个威尔士男孩儿。

The slave has never experienced the sweetness of freedom.     这个奴隶从未体验过自由的快乐。 Sweetness of thy name fills my heart when I forget mine- like thy morning sun when the mist is melted.     您的名字的甜蜜充溢着我的心&而我忘掉了我自己的&——就象您的早晨的太阳升起时&那大雾便消失了。
The dentist told the boy not to eat too many sweets.     牙医告诫这男孩不要吃太多糖果。 The bag of sweets on the table was too strong a temptation for the child to resist.     桌上那包糖果对那孩子是个难以抗拒的诱惑.

column2: n. 增大&隆起的部分&巨浪 a. 优秀的&上流的 v. 增大&使...膨胀&积聚
column3: The wind swelled out the sail.     风吹得船帆鼓了起来。 Her ankle swelled up after the fall.     她跌倒后脚踝肿了起来。

column2: v. 膨胀(泡胀) a. 膨胀的(增大的)
column3: Wood often swells when wet.     木材潮湿後往往会膨胀. The swelling on her finger was caused by a foreign body in it.     她的手指肿胀是手指内有异物引起的。

column2: v. 汗流浃背 vi. 酷热
column3: It's sweltering today.     今天热叫人发昏。 Open the window; it's sweltering in here!     打开窗户&这里热得要命！
She swept the floor clean.     她把地板打扫干净。 The flue should draw better once it's been swept.     烟道一经清扫&通风情况应好些。

column2: vi. 1. 突然转向;转弯;偏离方向   2. 背离[(+from)] vt.1. 使突然转向;使转弯  2. 使背离[(+from)] n.[C]1. 转向;偏离方向  2. 偏离的程度
column3: I will never swerve from my declared policy on this matter.     我决不背离我已经宣布的在这个问题上的政策。 The car swerved to the right.     汽车突然向右转。

column2: a. 快的&迅速的 ad. 快速地 n. 雨燕
column3: They've been very swift to deny these rumors.     他们在辟谣方面反应迅速。 The president promised swift and effective retribution against the terrorists.     总统答应会迅速有效地惩罚恐怖分子。

At a rapid pace; swiftly.     飞快地；迅速地 A brief high-pitched humming or buzzing sound& such as that made by a swiftly passing object or a taut vibrating string.     尖啸声一种短暂尖锐的嗡嗡声或滋滋声&例如高速运动的物体和拉紧的震颤的线发出的声音
We condemned the violence in swiftness.     我们立即谴责了那种暴行。 His reaction of swiftness surprised us.     他迅速的反应让我们吃了一惊。

column2: n. 大喝&吞咽 v. 豪饮&大口地喝
column3: John kept swigging at the bottle of brandy.     约翰对着那瓶白兰地酒大口地喝个不停。 Are they still swigging at that bottle? They'll soon be drunk.     他们还在拿着瓶子暴饮吗？他们马上就会醉的。
The rugby players were swilling mugs of beer at the bar.     橄榄球运动员正在酒吧间痛饮啤酒。 Make sure the garage is well swilled out.     请务必将车库里里外外都冲洗干净。
He can swim breaststroke& backstroke and crawl.     他会游蛙泳、仰泳和自由泳。 She's teaching the children to swim.     她正在教孩子们游泳。
The swimmer got cramp in his legs and had to be helped out of the water.     游泳者两腿抽筋&不得不由他人救助出水。 The swimmer emerged from the lake.     游泳者从湖中出来.
I have two pairs of swimming trunks.     我有两条游泳裤。 Swimming is a good form of exercise.     游泳是一种很好的运动。
There is a swimming pool in the park.     公园里有一个游泳池。 The children ducked each other in the swimming pool.     孩子们在游泳池里互相把对方按入水中。

column2: vt. 诈取(骗取&骗局) n. 诈取(骗取&骗局)
column3: An instance of cheating; a swindle.     诈骗一个欺诈的例子；诈取 He's just the kind that would stoop to swindle children out of a few pence.     他就是这种货色&会不顾廉耻去从孩子手中骗取几个零钱。
With this customer& he felt himself& as it were& casting pearls before swine.     面对这个客商&他感到好像是在对牛弹琴。 A swine over fat is the cause of his own bane.     猪死都因身过肥；象以齿焚。

column2: n. 摇摆&改变&冲力 v. 摇摆&使...旋转&动摇
column3: He took a swing at the tree with his axe.     他挥斧砍树。 The children were swinging on a rope.     孩子们抓着绳子荡来荡去。

column2: 乱搞男女关系的人；赶时髦的人
column3: That guy is a real swinger.     这个人可真是个时髦人物。

column2: n. 猛击&重击 vt. 重击&猛打
column3: Who's swiped my calculator?     谁把我的计算器偷走了? He swiped at the dog with his stick& but missed.     他用手杖向那条狗打去& 但没打中.

column2: a. 孪生的 n. 双胞胎之一
column3: She gave birth to twins.     她生了一对双胞胎。 They have twin daughters.     他们有一双孪生女儿。

column2: n. 一扭&扭曲 v. 拧&扭曲

column3: There are two types of rocks in this area.     这个地区有两种类型的岩石。 Could you type this letter for me?     你能为我打这封信吗？
In printing& a complete range of design variants of a particular typeface.     在印刷技术中&一整套不同设计的特殊字样。
I did the letter on my electric typewriter.     我是用电动打字机打这封信的。 She inserted a new sheet of paper into the typewriter.     她把一张白纸插入打字机里。

column2: a. 伤寒性的 n. 伤寒
column3: He developed typhoid fever.     他染上了伤寒。 Typhoid is an example of a notifiable disease.     伤寒是必须报告卫生当局的病例.
There was a threat of typhoon.     有刮台风的征兆。 The area is flooded& as frequently happens during the typhoon.     这个地区淹了水&这是台风时经常发生的。

column2: a. 典型的&有代表性的
column3: She is a typical Taurus/Taurean/has a typical Taurean personality.     她有典型的金牛座性格. They reacted to the appalling weather with typical British stoicism.     他们忍受著恶劣天气的煎熬& 表现了英国人典型的坚忍不拔的精神.

column2: ad. 代表性地& 作为特色地
column3: He is typically American.     他是典型的美国人。 Typically& he would come in late and then say that he had to go early.     他一向是来得很晚&然后又总说他得早走。
A good typist can finish typing the long article in a short while.     一位好打字员可在短短时间内完成这一长长的文章。 The typist is away on holiday this week.     打字员本周休假.

column2: a. 暴虐的&压制的&残暴的
column3: She works for a tyrannical new boss.     她在一个专横的新上司手下工作。 He has a tyrannical reign on his empire.     他是个残暴的皇帝。
The world has experienced many tyrannies.     这个世界已经经历过许多个专政政权。 People will remember the tyrannies of his reign.     人们不会忘记他统治时期的暴行。
The emperor was a tyrant.     那皇帝是个暴君。 This ruler is a pitiless tyrant.     这个统治者是一个冷酷的暴君。
There is no tread on the tyre - you should put on a new one.     这条轮胎已经磨平了&你应该换一条新的。 The tyre is too hard reduce the pressure a bit.     这轮胎太硬&要减少一点压力。
No& it can not be a ufo.     不&不可能是个不明飞行物。 Have any of you actually seen a UFO?     你们中间是不是有人确实看到过飞碟？
His house looks terrible with those pieces of ugly furniture.     那些难看的家具使得他的家看上去一团糟糕。 What an ugly mutt!     多难看的杂种狗哇!
The old man has a stomach ulcer.     那个老人得了胃溃疡。 My mouth has an ulcer.     我的口腔出现了溃疡。

Ultimately& the success of the product depends on the good marketing.     最终&产品的成功还是取决于高明的销售手段。 Every value they created ultimately redounded to his boss.     他们创造的价值最后全进了他们老板的腰包。

The doctors gave him an ultrasonic brain scan.     医生给他做了脑部超声波扫描检查。 An instrument that in a painless and noninvasive manner uses the differential transmission and reflection of ultrasonic waves to create a detailed visual image of the brain.     超声波心动描记器一种用来显示详细的大脑图象的仪器&利用超声波发送和反射的差异来测试并无伤无痛
Diagnostic imaging in which ultrasound is used to visualize an internal body structure or a developing fetus.     超声波扫描术利用超声波来显示耳体结构或胚胎发育情况的诊断用的成像法
They use ultraviolet lamp to kill pests.     他们使用紫外线灯杀死害虫。 Enhancing the effects of or inducing a toxic reaction to light& especially to ultraviolet light.     光中毒的加强光的有毒反应影响的&或引起光的有毒反应的&尤指紫外线的光线
The wind blew my umbrella inside out.     风把我的伞吹得翻过去了。 You should take an umbrella just as a precaution.     你该带把伞&有备无患。

column2: a. 不能的&不会的 v. 不能&不会

Such behavior is unacceptable in a civilized society.     这样的行为在文明社会里是不能接受的。 The theory he put forward at the meeting was entirely at fault and was therefore unacceptable.     他在会上提出的理论完全不可靠&因此是不能接受的。

column2: a. 不矫揉造作的&自然的&不装饰的

An optical instrument that uses a lens or a combination of lenses to produce magnified images of small objects& especially of objects too small to be seen by the unaided eye.     显微镜用一个透镜或一些透镜的组合来制造小物体的放大形像的视力工具&通常用来观察肉眼看不到的物体

column2: a. 无随员的&无侍从的&无伴的

A term applied to a computer system& spaces& or operating procedures when considering the protection of data from corruption or unauthorized access.     为了加强数据的保护&防止非法的存取&用于评价计算机系统、存储空间和运行过程完整程度的一种指标。 Containing information& the unauthorized disclosure of which poses the gravest threat to national security.     绝密极其保密的信息&任何不经许可的揭密都会对国家安全造成最严重的危胁

The unbound sheets of paper were piled up on the table.     还没有装订成册的论文稿件堆放在桌子上。

Pertaining to a signal or area which contains either encrypted classified or unclassified information.     用于修饰或说明包含加密的保密或不保密信息的信号或区域。

They often infiltrate into key positions and seek to undermine the body politic from within.     要提防隐蔽的敌人&他们经常渗透到关键岗位企图从内部破坏国家政体。

Our folly has undone us.     我们的愚蠢行为将自己毁了。 It's better for the doer to undo what he has done.     解铃还需系铃人。

a. 不平顺的&不均匀的&奇数的

A large or ungainly automobile.     大汽车巨大的或笨拙的汽车 An ungainly gesture.     不雅的姿势。

The unification of Italy resulted in a single country instead of several kingdoms.     意大利统一的结果是出现了一个国家&而 不是好几个王国。 Europe's plans for further unification may be up in the air& but people from Helsinki to Rome have been learning an often painful lesson in recent weeks about how entwined their economies have already become.     欧洲进一步统一的计划可以尚未定案&可是从赫尔辛基到罗马的人在最近几星期得到一个时常令人痛苦的教训：他们各国的经济已经如何地牵扯在一起了。

column2: a. 一致的&统一的 n. 制服
