column2: conj. 当...时(可是&虽然&只要)
column3: In data security& the transmission of data to unauthorized users by processes with legitimate access to data. A compiler& for example& could leak a proprietary program whilst it is being compiled.     在数据保密学中&通过合法访问数据的进程将数据传输给未授权的用户的过程。例如&编译程序在编译期间便可能泄漏专用程序。

column2: n. 鞭&车夫 v. 鞭打&挥动&突然攫取
column3: Their team really whipped ours at volleyball.     他们的排球队彻底击败了我们队。 He cracked his whip and the horses began to trot.     他噼噼啪啪地挥鞭策马狂跑。

column2: n. 回旋&旋转&急走 v. 使...旋转&循环而行
column3: His head whirled.     他头昏了。 He can't adjust himself to the whirl of modern life in this big city.     他无法适应这个大都市的现代生活的忙碌。
He has heavy whiskers.     他长着很重的连鬓胡子。 The candidate lost the election by a whisker.     该候选人以微弱劣势失去了竞选
This whisky is very good.     这种威士忌非常好。 Whisky is marked up by 150%.     威士忌在成本价上增加150%.

column2: n. 耳语&密谈&飒飒的声音 v. 耳语&密谈&飒飒地响
column3: The children were whispering in the corner.     孩子们正在角落里低声耳语。 The wind was whispering in the roof.     屋顶上风声飒飒。

column2: n. 口哨&汽笛&啸啸声 v. 吹口哨&鸣汽笛&用口哨通知
column3: He gave a loud whistle of gladness.     他吹了一声响亮的口号表示高兴。 A bullet whistled past his head.     一颗子弹从他头顶上呼啸而过。

column2: a. 白色的 n. 白色&白种人
column3: Her face turned white at the news.     听到这个消息&她的脸色变白了。 She went as white as a sheet when she heard the news.     她听到这个消息顿时脸色苍白。

column2: n. 白色涂料&白粉胶泥水&化
column3: The opposition dismissed the report as a whitewash.     反对党认为这份报告过于修饰而不予理会。 I'll have my little house whitewashed tomorrow.     明天我找人用石灰水粉刷一下小屋。

column2: prep. …的&谁&他&她&他们 pron. 谁
column3: This is the man who wanted to see you.     这就是要见你的那个人。 Who do you think you are?     你以为你是谁？

column2: ad. 无论是谁&任何人 pron. 究竟是谁&谁&无论谁&不管谁
column3: Whoever can that be at the door?     在门口的究竟是谁呢？ Whoever told you that was lying.     谁对你说这话&谁就在说谎。

column2: a. 整个的 n. 全部
column3: The whole country was anxious for peace.     全国上下都渴望和平。 I just threw the whole caboodle in the back of the car.     我把所有东西都扔到汽车後座上去了。

column2: n. 批发 a. 批发的&大规模的&草率的 ad. 大规模&照批发&草率地
column3: The wholesale prices of these shirts are 45 dollars.     这些衬衫的批发价是45美元。 He buys the materials wholesale.     他成批地购买原材料。

Owing to being that the electronic component is formed& and not wearing& and whether not to have the method does his having be used& and so wholesaler can sell very easily old the chip like being sold the new chip.     由于是电子元件构成&没有磨损&也没有方法办他的是否被用过&所以批发商可以象卖新的芯片一样非常容易地销售旧的芯片。 As you know& we are a well-established firm in the line of textiles& and we enjoy good relations with all the wholesalers& chain stores and distributors in Canada.     你知道&我公司在纺织业有良好的信誉&跟加拿大所有的批发商、连锁商店和分销商都保持很好的关系。

column2: a. 有益健康的&合乎卫生的&健全的
column3: It wouldn't be wholesome for you to go there.     你去那儿恐怕不安全。 In order to maintain physical well being& a person should eat wholesome food and get sufficient exercise.     为了维持身体健康&一个人应该吃有益健康的食品&并经常锻炼身体。
You are not wholly to blame for the accident.     你不应承担事故的全部责任。 He doesn't wholly agree to the plan.     他并不完全同意这项计划。
That is the man about whom we were speaking.     他就是我们刚才谈论的那个人。 Whom did they invite?     他们邀请谁了?

column2: n. 大叫&呐喊&喘息声 v. 叫喊&喘息
column3: When the land was seen& the sailor let out a whoop of joy.     当看见陆地时&那水手发出一声欢呼。 The train whooped out through the suburbs.     火车隆隆地驶出郊区。
Whose house is that?     那是谁的房子？ Whose pen is this?     这是谁的钢笔？

column2: ad. 为什么 conj. …的理由&为什么 int. 咳&哎呀 pron. 为何&为什么
column3: Why not let her do as she likes?     为什么不让她想怎么做就怎么做呢？ The reasons why he did it are obscure.     他做那事的理由还不清楚。

column2: a. 坏的&邪恶的&缺德的
column3: The little boy had a wicked twinkle in his eyes.     这个男孩的眼睛里闪烁着调皮的光。 It's a wicked waste of money.     这样浪费金钱简直是罪恶。

column2: a. 广泛的&宽阔的 ad. 广大地&全部地
column3: She stared at him with wide eyes.     她睁大眼睛注视他。 He is a man of wide interests.     他兴趣广泛。

column2: a. 广泛的 ad. 广泛地
column3: This accident is widely known.     这场事故众所周知。 They differ widely in their opinions.     他们的意见分歧很大。
He wants to widen his knowledge of the industry.     他想扩充自己在这一行业的知识。 The road is being widened.     这条路正在拓宽。
A widening in a highway to allow vehicles to pass or park.     避车道&停车道高速分路上可以错车或停的宽大空间 A gap between revenue and spending; the widening gap between rich and poor.     收入和消费之间的差距；富人与穷人之间很大的悬殊

column2: a. 分布(或散布)广的&普遍的
column3: The forests are widespread in our country.     我们的国家森林分布很广。 Widespread flooding is affecting large areas of Devon.     洪水泛滥& 淹没了德文郡的广大地区.
That widow is a kind person.     那个寡妇是个善良的人。 We had compassion for the poor widow.     我们同情这个可怜的寡妇。
The widower did not remarry.     那鳏夫未曾再娶. Once old Joe had inured himself to the solitary life of a widower& he began to improve in health and spirit.     一旦老乔适应了鳏夫的孤独生活&他的身体和精神状况便开始好转了。
The garden is six meters in width.     花园的宽度为六米。 Tornadoes are violent whirlwinds which vary in their width from a few yards to 1300 feet.     龙卷风是一种猛烈的旋风&其直径从几码到1300 英尺。
She wields a lot of influence.     她是个很有影响力的人。 Easily wielded or managed.     易使用的&易管理的
She is a good wife and a devoted mother.     她是一位贤妻良母。 Did you know he was cheating on his wife?     你知道他欺骗他的妻子吗？

column2: a. 放荡的&未开发的&野的&野生的&原始的 n. 荒野
column3: North America has the world's best climate for wild grapes.     北美的气候是世界上最适合野生葡萄生长的。 He is wild to see the film star.     他一心想见一面那位影星。

From his attic window he looked out over a wilderness of roofs.     从他阁楼的窗子望出去&他看到一大片屋顶。 Abraham rose early in the morning& took some food and a waterskin full of water and gave it to Hagar; he set the child on her shoulder and sent her away& and she went and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.     亚伯拉罕第二天一早起来&拿了些食物和一皮袋水给夏甲。他让孩子伏在夏甲户上送好上路。她走到别是巴荒野里迷了路。
There was some marvellous wildlife photography in the documentary.     这部记录片里有些绝妙的野生动物镜头。 Our community is a leader in the conservation of wildlife.     我们社区在野生动物保护方面走在前头。

column2: n.意志& 决心& 愿望& 遗嘱 aux.将& 愿意& 必须
column3: I will do my best.     我将会尽力而为。 Free will makes us able to choose our way of life.     自由的意志使我们可以选择自己的生活方式。
Are you willing to help?     你愿意帮忙吗？ He is always a willing helper.     他是一个乐于帮忙的人。
I'd be the first to admit (ie I will most willingly admit) I might be wrong.     我愿第一个承认我可能错了. Though she'd lost her job& she saved face by saying she'd left it willingly.     她失去了工作& 却说是自愿离职以保全面子.
He indicated his willingness with a nod of his head.     他点头表示愿意。 They tried to assure him of their willingness to work.     他们尽力使他相信他们乐意工作.
Willowes are common in this city.     柳树在这个城市很常见。 Bring up in town& the boy find it difficult to separate a poplar from a willow.     那男孩是在城里长大的&所以觉得很难区别杨树和柳树。
He soon won a reputation for himself.     他很快就成名了。 Her performance won her much critical acclaim.     她的表演大获评论界赞颂。

column2: n. 风&气味&卷 v. 上发条&缠绕&蜿蜒
column3: The river winds to the sea.     那条河蜿蜒地流入大海。 The deer winded the stalkers.     那只鹿嗅出了偷偷接近的猎人。

column2: n. 卷&弯曲&线圈 a. 蜿蜒的&卷绕的&弯曲的 vbl. 卷绕&上发条&蜿蜒
column3: I went home along a winding mountain path.     我沿着弯曲的山路回家。 You operate the mechanism by winding this handle.     操纵这台机器要转动这个把手.
Windmills are a common sight in Holland.     风车是荷兰常见的景色。 The sails of the windmill were wheeling round.     风车的叶轮正在旋转。
He looked out of the window.     他向窗外看去。 I saw the vase in the window of an antique shop.     我在一家古玩店的橱窗里看见了那个花瓶。

column2: 微软公司生产的“视窗”操作系统
column3: She stared out of the windows& lost in daydreams.     她凝视窗外&陷入白日梦中。 The cold has frosted the windows.     寒冷的天气使窗子上结满了霜。

column2: a. 有风的& 多风的
column3: It's windy today.     今天有风。 A feather floats about on the air& especially on a windy day. If there is a shower of rain& the feather will get wet and heavy with water& and then it will sink straight to the ground.     羽毛会在空中四处飘动&尤其是在多风的天气。如果遇上阵雨&就会因为淋上雨水变湿就沉&然后就会垂直落回到地上。
He likes to drink red wine at supper.     他喜欢在晚饭时喝红葡萄酒。 Wine cups and dishes lay about in disorder in the room.     屋里杯盘狼藉。
The bird's left wing was hurt.     这只鸟的左翼受伤了。 The nearside wing was damaged in the collision.     汽车碰撞时左侧的翼子板撞坏了。

column2: n. 眨眼&使眼色&瞬间 v. 眨眼&使眼色&闪烁
column3: She winked at me.     她向我眨眼。 A lighthouse was winking in the far distance.     一座灯塔正在远处闪烁。
Who's the winner of the tennis match?     这次网球赛的优胜者是谁？ They took many photos of the exultation of the winner.     他们拍了许多获胜者欢欣雀跃的照片。
Winter is the coldest season in a year.     冬季是一年中最冷的季节。 It became fashionable for the rich to winter in the sun.     在阳光充足的地方过冬成了富人的时尚。

column2: n. 擦拭&用力打 v. 擦&消除&拭去
column3: I wiped my shoes on the mat before I came in.     我在进门前把鞋在垫子上擦了擦。 She wiped her tears away.     她擦掉了眼泪。

column2: n. 电线&电报&金属丝 v. 给…装电线&发电报
column3: The rope was not strong enough& so we used wire.     这根绳子不够结实&所以我们用金属线。 The two pieces of wood were wired together.     这两块木头已用金属丝捆在一起了。

column2: a. 无线的 n. 无线电
column3: The police talked to each other by wireless.     警察用无线电通话。 He sent me the news by wireless telegraph.     他用无线电报把消息告诉我。
He examined the wiring scheme carefully.     他仔细检查线路图。 All this electrical wiring will take a day to set up.     所有这些电线架线要花一天时间安装好。
He is a man of great wisdom.     他是一个才智超群的人。 According to conventional wisdom& voters usually make their choice on the basis of domestic issues.     按一般人在这些问题上的看法&选民常常着眼于国内问题来选择候选人。

column2: a. 明智的&有学问的&有智慧的&聪明的
column3: She is wise in money matters.     她善于理财。 You are wise to remain silent.     你保持沉默&这很明智。

column2: n. 希望&愿望&祝颂 v. 愿&想要&希望
column3: His wish to be an actor has come true.     他想当演员的愿望实现了。 I wish you a good journey.     祝你一路平安。
Oscar Wilde was a famous wit.     奥斯卡·王尔德是个著名的风趣的人。 He hadn't the wit to say no.     他笨得连说一句拒绝的话都不会说。
The witch turned the princess into a swan.     巫婆把公主变成了一只天鹅。 The witch charmed the prince.     女巫对王子施了魔法。
You are either with me or against me.     你不是支持我就是反对我。 She is friendly with them.     她对他们很友好。
He withdrew his horse from the race.     他让他的马退出了比赛。 The troops have been withdrawn from the danger area.     部队已经撤出危险地带。
He has made several withdrawals from his account recently.     最近他已经好几次从银行提取现款。 The committee decided to make a withdrawal of financial support for his scheme.     委员会决定取消对他那项计划的资助。

column2: v. 提取(取出&分离&撤退&拉晶) a. 偏僻的
column3: She withdrew all her savings and left the country.     她把全部存款取出後离开了那个国家. The troops have been withdrawn from the danger area.     部队已经撤出危险地带。
The cold withered the leaves.     严寒使树叶凋落。 The grapes withered on the vine.     葡萄藤上的葡萄都干瘪了。
I withheld payment until they had fulfilled the contract.     他们履行合同后&我才付钱。 How shall I withhold from tears when we part?     我们离别时我如何忍得住眼泪呢？

column2: ad. 在内 n. 里面 prep. 在...里面
column3: I'll be coming within an hour.     一小时之内我就会到。 This is a task well within your ability.     这完全是你力所能及的工作。

column2: ad. 在外面 n. 外面&外部 prep. 无&没有
column3: The rumor was without foundation.     那条谣言毫无根据。 Without the sun& nothing would grow.     没有太阳&就不会有生物。
Children's furniture must withstand kicks and blows.     孩子用的家具必须经得起拳打脚踢。 This dress material will withstand repeated washing.     这种衣料经得住反复洗涤。

column2: n. 目击者&证人 v. (为...)作证&目击 vt. 目击
column3: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.     警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。 Did anyone witness the traffic accident?     有谁目击了这场交通事故？

column2: a. 富于机智的&诙谐的
column3: His witty remark caused a storm of laughter.     他的妙语引起一阵哄堂大笑。 Although the subject-matter (of her talk) was rather dull her witty delivery kept the audience interested.     尽管（她讲的）内容有些枯燥& 但由於她善於表达& 大家仍听得津津有味.

column2: n. 男巫&术士&鬼才 a. 男巫的&巫术的
column3: He is a wizard at playing the piano.     他是个钢琴奇才。 Having the qualities or attributes of a wizard.     魔法的&术士的有巫师的特点或性质的

column2: n. 悲哀&悲痛&苦痛&不幸&困难
column3: Woe betide anyone who arrives late!     谁迟到谁倒霉！ He told her all his woes.     他把自己的辛酸事都告诉她了。
It is said that there are wolves in this forest.     据说这片森林里有狼。 He saw a hungry wolf on the prowl with his telescope.     他通过望远镜看到了一头四处觅食的饿狼。
Woman is physically but not mentally weaker than man.     女子在体力上而不是智力上比男子弱。 She is a career woman rather than a housewife.     她是职业妇女而不是家庭主妇。

column2: n. 奇迹&惊奇&惊谔 v. 惊奇&想知道&怀疑 adj.奇妙的&非凡的
column3: They wondered at his learning.     他们对他的学识感到惊奇。 They stared at the strange sight in silent wonder.     他们惊讶地默默凝视那奇景。
Autumn is a wonderful season.     秋天是极好的季节。 The child's skill is wonderful for his age.     这个孩子小小年纪&技巧令人称奇。
You should put some more wood in the fire.     你应该再往火里添些木料。 Pine is a soft wood and teak is a hard wood.     松木是软木&柚木是硬木。
The actress gave a rather wooden performance.     那个女演员的表演相当呆板。 Our wooden sofa seems not very comfortable.     我们的木头沙发似乎不太舒服。
Woodpeckers have long beaks.     啄木鸟长着长嘴。 All the woodpeckers have scansorial feet.     所有的啄木鸟都有适於攀爬的脚。
The police searched all the woods within a six-mile radius.     警察搜索了在周围六英里以内的树林各处。 Their family often picnics in the woods.     他们一家常在树林里野餐。
This wool suit is very expensive.     这套毛料套装十分昂贵。 The wool got in a fearful tangle.     毛线乱成了一团。

column2: n. 毛制品 a. 羊毛的&羊毛制的&毛织的
column3: We have to wear woolen clothes in the cold winter.     寒冷的冬天&我们不得不穿毛织品。 This woolen sweater may keep you warm in winter.     这件羊毛衫在冬天可以保暖。

column2: n. 毛织品 a. 羊毛制的
column3: A man was lying in the box on top of a pile of woollen goods.     一个男人躺在箱子里的一堆毛织品上。 The woollen cloth prickles (my skin).     穿毛料衣服（使我的皮肤）有被扎的感觉.

column2: n. 词&单词&消息&诺言 vt. 用词语表达
column3: My friend sent word that he was well.     我朋友捎来口信说他很好。 Tell me what happened in your own words.     用你自己的话把发生的事情告诉我。
He cast his last remark in more formal wording.     他用更正式的措词表达了最后一句话。 I find it helpful to keep several dictionaries by me so as to compare their wording.     我发现身边放几本词典很有益处&这样便于比较它们的措词。
His words were followed by a pregnant pause.     他说完话&接着是一段意味深长的停顿。 The teacher's words were a great encouragement to him.     教师的话对他是极大的鼓舞。

column2: a. 文字的&口头的&多言的
column3: A wordy phrase or sentence that has little meaning.     赘语无意义的施沓冗长的短语或句子
It was hard work getting the children off to bed.     哄孩子们去睡可不是容易的事。 Your car radio works very well.     你的汽车收音机性能很好。

column2: a. 易加工的(可使用的&切实可行的)
column3: If we put our heads together we can probably thresh out a workable scheme.     如果我们集思广益&也许能琢磨出一个切实可行的方案。 Such a scheme is workable.     这样的方案是行得通的。
Our ordinary workday is eight hours.     我们正常的工作日是8小时。 An eight-hour workday.     八小时工作日
He is a skilled worker.     他是个熟练工人。 The worker is dyeing cloth in a vat.     工人正在一个大桶里染布。
Laid-off workers fall into penury.     下岗职工陷入贫困。 All the female workers in this factory got a present on March 8.     这家工厂的所有女职工在三八节都得到了一份礼物。
The farmer's harrow was broken during his working.     农夫正在劳动的时候&耙子断了。 I'm working on it.     我正在努力。
The workmen fixed the water system.     工人们装好了供水系统。 Our new washing-machine keeps breaking down it's entirely due to shoddy workmanship.     我们的新洗衣机老出毛病－－完全是因为做的质量太差。
Look at the workmanship on the carved desk.     看这雕花桌子的工艺多么精湛。 They admired her workmanship.     他们很钦佩她的手艺.

column2: 结构物 厂 制造厂
column3: They are repairing the defense works.     他们正在修防御工程。 She works in a sugar refinery.     她在一家制糖厂工作。

column2: n. 车间&工场&研讨会&讲习班
column3: We'll have a poetry workshop.     我们将开个诗歌研习会。 There are more than fifty workers in this workshop.     这个车间里有五十多个工人。

column2: n. 工作站 工作站

column3: He is the richest man in the world.     他是世界上最富有的人。 The travel enlarged my world.     这次旅行扩大了我的眼界。
That shall do it& thank you for call worldwide flowers. Bye.     那好&谢谢你给我们打电话。再见。 Hello. worldwide flowers. Ers. Green speaking.     喂&这是世界花卉公司&我是格林太太。
You miserable worm!     你这个可怜虫！ Many birds eat worms.     很多鸟类都以虫子为食。

column2: n. 烦恼&忧虑&苦恼 v. 使...烦恼&焦虑&苦恼

column2: a. 更坏的&更差的 ad. 更坏&更差
column3: I'm afraid he is getting steadily worse.     恐怕他的病情越来越严重了。 We thought that the situation was as bad as it could be& but worse was to follow.     我们还以为那是最坏的情况呢&可没想到更糟的还在后面。

column2: n. 崇拜&礼拜 v. 崇拜&敬仰 vi. 做礼拜 vt. 崇拜
column3: She was blind to the silent worship in his eyes.     她没有发觉他眼里流露出的无声的敬慕之情。 The boy worshipped his father.     这小孩崇拜他的父亲。

column2: a. 最坏的&最差的 ad. 最坏&最差 n. 最坏&最差&最糟
column3: That was the worst airline disaster in history.     那是历史上最严重的空难。 It's the old and the poor who suffer worst when subsidies are cut.     补助津贴一削减&最吃苦头的就是那些老人和贫民。

column2: n. 价值 prep.&a. 值...钱&值得...的
column3: The house is worth a lot of money.     这栋房子值很多钱。 Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well.     任何值得做的事就值得做好。
I feel that such gatherings are worthless.     我认为这样的集会毫无价值。 She was worthless as a violinist.     她作为小提琴手一无所成。
That's worthwhile.     那是值得的。 Thank you for making my visit so worthwhile. I shall treasure your friendship and kind hospitality you have given me.     感谢你们使我的访问如此有价值。我将珍惜我们之间的友谊及你们给予我的盛情款待。

column2: a. 有价值的&可尊敬的&值得的&配得上的
column3: She proved herself a worthy successor to the former champion.     她证明了自己是前冠军的当之无愧的接替人。 We esteem him to be worthy of trust.     我们认为他值得信任。

column2: conj. 将&愿意 will 的过去式
column3: Would you please lend me your pencil?     请把铅笔借给我用用好吗？ They wanted to know when you would go to the park.     他们想知道你们什么时候去公园。

column2: a. 受伤的 n. 伤员
column3: The wounded boy could not forbear to cry out.     受伤的男孩忍不住哭了。 This wounded soldier was unconscious from his loss of blood.     这名伤员由于失血过多而昏迷不醒。

column2: n. 披肩&围巾 v. 覆盖&包围&裹&包 n. 包裹 vt. 包&裹

In word processing& an editing feature in which the system automatically adjusts the right hand margin for insertion or deletion of copy during playback. Word and sometimes page wraparound is automatically performed as needed.     字（词）处理技术中的一种编辑特性&在此特性下&系统在副本中插入或删除后&右边自动对齐。在需要时&系统自动完成卷字和卷页。
Please put all your sweet wrappers in the dustbin.     请把你们的糖纸都放进垃圾箱里去。 The book has a red wrapper.     这本书有红色的包装。

They put some wreathes on the ground.     他们把一些花环放在地上。 The Queen pain homage to the victims of two world wars by laying a wreath on the Cenotaph.     女王向纪念碑了献花圈&以此向两次世界大战这中的牺牲者们表示敬意。

column2: v. 环绕&盘绕&作成花圈
column3: Mist wreathed the hilltops.     山顶上薄雾环绕。 The local people used to wreathe the guest's head in leaves.     当地人过去常把树叶缠在宾客的头上。

column2: n. 失事&残骸&破坏&健康受损的人 vt. 破坏&造成...失事

column2: a. 可怜的&不幸的&卑鄙的
column3: He felt wretched after illness.     他病后感到苦恼。 The hotel food was absolutely wretched.     那家旅馆的饭菜极差。

column2: n. 扭绞 v. 拧&绞出&扭
column3: Give the wet clothes a wring.     把那些湿衣服拧一下。 He wrung his hands in sorrow.     他悲伤地绞紧双手。

column3: She's beginning to get wrinkles round her eyes.     她的眼角开始有皱纹了。 He wrinkled up his forehead in perplexity.     他困惑地皱起了眉头。

I've been writing for three hours.     我已经写了三个小时了。 I wish he would write more often.     我希望他来信更勤些。
He became a writer.     他成了一名作家。 The writer of the book lived in the eighteenth century.     这本书的作者生活在十八世纪。

column2: n. 著述&笔迹&作品 vbl. 写&著述

column2: a. 书面的&写成文字的 vbl. 写&著述

column2: a. 错误的&不正当的&失常的 ad. 错误&邪恶

Oh& yeah?     哦&是吗? Yeah& if it's not too far away.     如果不太远的话&那好。

column2: a. 每年的 ad. 每年&一年一次地

column2: a. 是的 ad. 是&是的 v. 是

column2: ad. 还&仍然 conj. 然而

column2: a. 年轻的 n. 青年人
column3: This young girl is my daughter.     这个年轻的女孩是我的女儿。 The young in our society need careand protection.     我们社会的年轻人需要受到关怀和爱护.
He looks ten years younger.     他看起来年轻了10岁。 If I were ten years younger& I'd study harder.     要是我年轻10岁&我就要更用功学习。
"People& especially youngsters don't seem so polite these days."     ＂如今人们&尤其是年青人好象不那么讲礼貌了。＂ It is hard for an old man to work as long as a youngster.     老年人要工作得和年轻伙子一样久是困难的。
Your hands are dirty.     你的手很脏。 These are your books.     这些是你们的书。
This is our room& and yours is down the passage.     这是我们的房间&你们的在走廊的那一头。 His view of life is different from yours.     他的人生观与你的不同。
You and your sister said so yourselves.     你和你姐姐都这么说。 I believe that you can work out this problem by yourself.     我相信你自己能做出这道题的。
You two have only yourselves to blame.     你们俩只能怪自己。 Taken care of yourselves.     照顾你们自己。
In his youth& he had shown great promise.     他在青少年时代就显得很有出息。 The youth of the country are being ignored by politicians.     这个国家的青年没有受到政治家的重视。
No one can remain youthful forever.     没有人能永保青春。
Pay back the5&000 Yuan I loan you by today.     我借给你的5&000元&今天还我吧。 The buy rate of US dollar note be846 yuan per hundred dollar.     美元的买入价是100美元付864元人民币。
I really admire her she's so full of zap!     我真佩服她--精力那麽充沛! Have you seen him zapping around town on his new motor bike?     你看见没看见他骑著自己的新摩托车在市区飞驰?
She shows great zeal for knowledge.     她表现出强烈的求知欲。 Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.     【谚】热情而无知&犹如无光之火。
The zealous demonstrators were ignored by the media.     热情的示威游行者被新闻媒介忽视了。 The doctors were zealous in their efforts to ensure the survival of premature babies.     医生们在努力保证早产婴儿成活方面热情很高。
Seemingly everyone likes the zebra.     似乎每个人都喜欢斑马。 Related to& resembling& or characteristic of a zebra.     斑马的与斑马有关的、与斑马相似的或具有斑马特征的
It was five below zero last night.     昨夜温度是零下五度。 His hope was reduced to zero.     他的希望化为乌有。

column2: n. 风味&强烈的兴味&风味

You should first put a small piece of zinc plate into the cup.     首先&要向杯子里放一小片锌板。 Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.     黄铜是铜和锌的合金。
This dress fastens (up) (ie has buttons& a zip& etc) at the back.     这件连衣裙是在背後系扣的. These new trains really zip along.     这些新列车行驶得可真快.
They escaped from the war zone.     他们逃出了交战区。 The Norwegians live in a comparatively cold zone.     挪威人生活在比较寒冷的地区。

column2: n. 急速上升 v. 突然扩大&急速上升
